loans.name: Zyrapa

texts.ru: Зырапа, 53 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и 7 коз, на 0,18 Га земли выращивает картофель для реализации. В доме есть швейная машинка, Зырапа шьет для своей семьи. Ежемесячный совокупный доход от бизнеса составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). Зырапа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, также в улучшение жилищных условий за счет покупки мебели.
texts.en: Zyrapa is 53 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops to get income for her family. She has two cows, ten sheep and seven goats, and she grows potatoes to sell on 0.18 hectares of land. She has a sewing machine at home, and Zyrapa sews for her family. Her gross monthly income from the business is about 30,000 som (KGS). Zyrapa has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase her herd. She plans to continue investing the proceeds of the loan in developing her business, and also in improving her family's living conditions by buying some furniture.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Bakytbek

texts.ru: Бакытбек, 43 года, женат, есть 3 сына и 2 дочери, они школьники. У Бакытбека- высшее образование, уже 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Бакытбека в хозяйстве есть корова и лошадь, выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу на 1,0 Га собственной земли для реализации. Бакытбек в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Бакытбек хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и полеводческую деятельность.
texts.en: Bakytbek is 43 years old, married, and has three sons and two daughters who are schoolchildren. Bakytbek has a higher education. He has been rearing animals and growing crops for 15 years. Thanks to his hard work, today Bakytbek has a cow and a horse, and he grows corn and wheat for sale on 1.0 hectares of his own land. In order to develop his business further, Bakytbek has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows. Bakytbek wants to invest the proceeds of the loan in increasing his number of domestic animals and in his crop growing activity.

loans.use: to purchase some cows to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Hoern's Group

texts.en:
Hoern is 44 years old. She is the mother of six children. She and her husband make a living through planting cassava, which they have been doing for five years. To earn more income, her husband also works for others for a fee.

Their current business earns them about 80,000 KHR per day and they are able to save about 40,000 KHR daily for the future needs.

This is the second loan for Hoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Hoern will use her portion to buy pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on labor.

Hoern hopes to produce more crops to sell for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her cassava.

loans.name: Olegario

texts.en:
Olegario engages in animal husbandry. He raises domesticated animals like goats, poultry and pigs. He is a 69 years old married man with three grown children. He has been engaged in that kind of livelihood for more than 20 years.
He resides in Barili, Cebu.

He would like to expand his livelihood by availing the funds that could made improvement on such source of income. Olegario would like to buy animal feeds and capital to purchase a computer for start up. These could boost his animal husbandry livelihood. Eventually, with the availability of these resources, Olegario would then like start to operate an internet cafe. Thus, his income will improve and he will be able to pay his obligations.

He dreams to become a successful business man someday, Olegario hopes.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and capital to purchase a computer for start up.

loans.name: Fe Merlyn

texts.en:
Fe Merlyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Fe Merlyn has been able to turn the tide in her favor and she is making good sales. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, Fe Merlyn hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita landed at a right place for needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after her first business went bad.

PMPC came to Emelita as a rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she is taking out another loan for the next cropping season. She will use the loan for land and seedbed preparation. Emelita perseveres and always strives to reach her goals to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is preparing for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare her land and seedbeds well. She wants to buy enough corn fertilizer for her crop so she applied for a loan from the cooperative. Luzminda hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is managing her eatery business in Pagadian. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This eatery has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family.

Lilian has local customers and would like to start catering for added income. Through her business activity, she was able to expand her business and has begun to stock basic commodities and consumable goods for retail.

She also sells soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be like to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is preparing for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, focusing especially on the much-needed land and seedbed preparations.

Loreta wants to pay for land preparations like plowing, harrowing, etc. She also wants to buy corn fertilizer for more produce, which is why she applied for a loan from the Cooperative.

Loreta hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for land preparations like plowing, harrowing, etc. & to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is single and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the coop.

Elsie is requesting a loan 50,000 PHP for her existing business to buy a variety of rice to sell in the local community. Elsie hopes to continue her business and to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice to sell retail in the local community.

loans.name: Rilah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM Syariah’s clients, Rilah, who is a 53-year-old, married woman. Rilah has been selling snacks for three years and her husband has been an employee for 25 years.

Rilah has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation in her home, to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Rilah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation in her home, to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family.

loans.name: Shomaila

texts.en:
Shomaila is 33 years old married women. She is mother of five children. Her husband is government employee. She has started thread business. She wants to support her family through her business.

She purchase variety of fabrics from different areas and converts them with beautiful braided threads and ribbons for sale in the main market.
Presently she needs to purchase some fabric as a inventory for further sales. However due to lack of finance she is facing problem. For that she is requested for loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. Shomaila is thankful to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to buy fabric for her thread business

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
A young woman who resides in Kampong Cham province, Chanthol, 20, is a university student. Recently, Chanthol has passed to go to an internship abroad for nine months; and for those months, she is going to get 10 USD per day.

Unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to prepare some important documents needed in order to travel to another country. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund Cambodia to prepare a visa, passport, and study material to provide efficiency for her studying.

She hopes that this loan will help her to get more experiences and pave the way to get a good job in the future.

loans.use: to prepare a visa, passport, and study material to provide efficiency for her studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a Palestinian entrepreneur who lives in Gaza City where the unemployment is very high. 15 years ago Diyala started her own business where she operates and manages a photography studio.

Khawla decided to go to Palestine for credit and development(FATEN) to take a USD loan that enables her to buy a professional camera to work with. Khawla dreams to be a famous photographer and own several professional cameras and help her family and serve her country
Khawla appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera for her studio.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a businesswoman from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 72 years old, a widow, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Josefina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Josefina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is managing a business and supervising the renovation of her family's home. Marissa hopes to live comfortably in a house with a good roof made possible by her loan of PHP 50,000.

Marissa hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Marissa has given top priority to being a Microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all the financing needs of her retail business are being supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a businesswoman in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is known for her palay (rice grains) buying and trading business. She also owns and operates a rice milling business.

Nancy is making good proceeds through this type of business. Nancy said that everything was made possible because of the support that Paglaum MPC has extended to her.

Recently, Nancy requested a loan to purchase more palay (rice grains) for rice milling and grain production.

loans.use: to purchase more palay (rice grains) for rice milling and grain production.

loans.name: El Asrar Group

texts.en:
Marcelle is the featured borrower for El Asrar Group. She joined with with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Marcelle is a 28-year-old married mother of two who is employed in a grocery shop five years ago to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. Today, Marcelle is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees, as she wants to prepare her family for the upcoming winter season through buying necessary viands and firewood.

Marcelle is the first lady on the right. Manal is the lady standing in the middle, and Hiyam is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees and buy viands and firewood for the winter season

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 35-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ayman will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Ayman’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Ayman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Prelyn

texts.en: Prelyn, 35 years old, is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her parents in Pagadian City. She is a farmer, focusing on rice and vegetable farming. She wants to increase her crop yield on her rice farm. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a hardworking father of two elementary students. He’s a resident of Binondo Manila, Philippines and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). He is only 30 years old and a husband of Mercy, a vendor. Jesus has been earning for a living as a tricycle driver for 10 years now. He and his wife are helping each other to support their family's needs.

Being a tricycle driver for that long has been very challenging for Jesus since change of weather mainly affects the income he might earn for the day. It’s during rainy season where he earns less since he always has to pay for the maintenance cost of his unit to make sure that it is safe to ride especially during this time of the year.

Jesus applied for a loan of Php 20,000 that he needs for the said purpose and also to buy grocery items for her variety store. This amount will be of great help for the business growth.

Jesus is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where he gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share his own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to improve his tricycle unit and grocery items for his variety store business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda operates a jeepney transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for jeepney spare parts and repair. She dreams of owning another jeepney unit and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for jeepney spare parts/repair

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en: Pablo is 48 years old and married with two adult-age children. He operates an auto repair shop that has existed for 14 years. Through this business, he is able to send his eldest daughter to college. To continuously provide for his family's needs, he availed a loan from the cooperative to buy 24 pieces of iron angle bars, welding rods, flat bars and others.

loans.use: to buy 24 pieces of iron angle bars, welding rods, flat bars and others.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities, from growing, caring, and harvesting, and earning income as well. Luzminda has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Luzminda has nurtured her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, Luzminda applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Luzminda hopes to purchase another plot of rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, so she will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia started her own small business and became the boss of her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventories and roll up her capital to gain more profit. Each day, she makes good sales since this is the only store in the barangay (village).

Recently, Lucia approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 36 years old married women. She is mother of four children and her husband is working abroad. She has started a clothing business along with her husband. They both want to support their family well through their business. She purchase variety of clothes from different areas and exports them.

Presently she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However due to lack of finance she is facing problem. For that she is requested for loan from kiva and his partner BRAC Pakistan. Samina is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothes for exporting abroad.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 37 years old lady and a responsible mother of 6 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own matting business for past 15 years. Zainab's husband needs to purchase different design of mats for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill the need of her husband Zainab has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise. It will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support his family's needs
Zainab is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase inventory in her husband's matting business.

loans.name: La Lagunita Group

texts.en:
“La Lagunita” is a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank located in the small town of Lagunita Chuipa near the city of San Miguel Uspantan in the State of El Quiche, Guatemala.  It is a very active Trust Bank with nine hardworking women between the ages of 22 and 52.  They average about three children per member with all the children attending school from elementary to high school.  Their businesses range from selling candy, to making “cortes” (traditional wrap-around skirts) and “huipiles” (ornately woven and embroidered traditional blouses), to convenience stores.  

The President of “La Lagunita” is Marcelina Sonia Vasquez who is 37 years old and  has been married for 21 years with three children ages 7, 14 and 19.  

Marcelina has been receiving loans from Friendship Bridge for four years and this is the first year that she is requesting one from KIVA.  She has an animal husbandry business raising pigs, chickens and turkeys.  She also makes tablecloths and backpacks, as well selling beans and corn.  She is a very busy woman.  Marcelina is requesting  a loan to buy more animals that she then can sell beyond her home in markets in nearby towns.

The 19 year old has graduated and is an elementary school teacher in a nearby town.  The other two are also attending school.  Marcelina’s goal is to continue to participate in the Trust Bank in order to provide an education for her children through high school.  She knows a good education will bring them a better quality of life.


On behalf of the members of “La Lagunita, Marcelina reports that the ladies are very satisfied with their successes of their businesses that have been a result of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge (loans + education).  They also are extremely happy with the monthly meetings where they have been able to learn about the importance of good investments and savings

Many thanks for supporting the growth and empowerment of the Maya women like Marcelina and the ladies in the “La Lagunita” Trust Bank!

loans.use: to buy more animals like pigs, chickens, and turkeys for sale.

loans.name: Estrela

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Xai-Xai, Província de Gaza tem 28 anos e idade, solteira, mãe de 1 filho menor de idade que frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011, este é o seu 5º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material construção como: areia, cimento, varões e mais, para terminar a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura para transportar os seus produtos.
texts.en:
She was born in Xai-Xai, Gaza province. She is 28 years old, single, and the mother of an underage child who goes to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2011. This is her fifth loan, and she is planning to use it to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement, and beams to finish building her house.

In the future, she plans to finish building her house, and buy a vehicle to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, beams, and other materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is able to keep her business through the financial assistance that CCT has entrusted her. She is grateful that there are people who are willing to help entrepreneurs like her. Because of the help extended to her, she is now earning for about Php 15,000 every month. Once more, she wants to send her sincerest appreciation as she was able to purchase various grocery products for her variety store business.

Lea has many plans for her family like she wants her children to finish college and that they will always be in good condition. She just started with a very small capital but now, through her business, she was able to pay for her children's school expenses and settle other bills as well. She aims her business to have visible progress yearly. She plans to buy additional stock of grocery items, bottled drinks and school supplies so she is asking again for an amount of Php 40,000 for this purpose. Lea hopes that CCT would consider again her loan request.

Lea regularly meets with her co-fellowship members on a weekly basis to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es de la ciudad de Villarrica, proviene de una familia trabajadora que se apoyan en todo momento, gracias a ellos pudo empezar a estudiar una carrera universitaria, que es la de ingeniería civil.
Actualmente está trabajando y con esfuerzo está sobrellevando sus estudios. Su meta a futuro es terminar su carrera y lo que me inspira a luchar es su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Richard is from the city of Villarrica. He comes from a hardworking family, one in which members support each other all the time. Thanks to them, he could start studying a higher-education program, i.e., Civil Engineering.

He is currently working, and continues studying thanks to his hard work. His goal for the future is to finish his studies. His family is what inspires him to fight.

He is requesting this loan to pay the university fees, and in that way become someone in life, and help his beloved ones through his studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en: Savuth’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Savuth makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a seller to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each man and woman in the group to safeguard the health of the family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad 37, is married and has one daughter and two sons. The only source of income to the family is a small carpentry project that he runs. Mohammad previously requested 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates.

He is requesting 8000 EGP loan to buy some wood for his project to increase his sales and guarantee better living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is applying for a loan of $ 600.00. She is married and she has a sales kiosk. Her husband is a farmer so her husband is very supportive for her to do business.

She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including biscuits, candle, noodles, nut, candies, crackers, including soft drinks and other things to sell. She started her business a few years ago with a small working capital. Now she has a small store, so with this loan she hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candle, noodles,  nut, candies, crackers, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 31-year-old, married man from Gaza city. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Hasan’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Hasan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en: Cherry Mae is married and lives in Pagadian City. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop. She's requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community. Cherry Mae hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is 40 years old and married with two school-age children. She is a farmer in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur together with her husband. She has cultivated their own land for almost four years. In 2011, Maribeth signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to access its financial service for her farming activities. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, comenta que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida, y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios, es una persona muy luchadora que ha pasado por muchos obstáculos pero que se sigue esforzando por salir adelante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le permitió seguir con sus estudios.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulacion, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene y cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Joel is pursuing his Law degree. He says that he is working hard to make something of himself and, through his studies, help his loved ones.

He is a very hard-working person, who has faced many obstacles, but who is putting forth his best efforts to get ahead. 

He says that he used his previous loan to pay his university fees, which enabled him to continue with his studies.

He is requesting this new loan to cover the expenses related to obtaining his degree and, in this way, fulfill his goals.

loans.use: to cover the expenses related to obtaining his degree.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está casado y tiene un hijo, por quienes ambos están luchando para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Él se dedica a la construcción de obras desde hace ya 10 años, y su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de despensa.
Son una pareja muy sacrificada, ambos se ayudan para poder mejorar el hogar y tener una vida digna y sin privaciones. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para seguir utilizándolos en las obras que viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Edgar is from the city of Ybycuí. He is married and has one child. He is fighting to be able to provide them a dignified life without undue hardships. He has worked in construction for 10 years and his wife has a small business, a grocery store.

They are a very self-sacrificing couple, both help each other to improve their household and have a dignified life, with what they need.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of construction materials to continue to use them in the jobs he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his work.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a chemist. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is engaged in running a fruits & vegetables store in Pagadian City. She has been operating her business for seven years and earns a monthly net income of 5,000 PHP. Lorena is 36 years old, married and has school-aged kids. Lorena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes.

Lorena is requesting her 10th loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells sweets, pens, paper bags and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sweets, pens, paper bags and other items. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweets, pens, paper bags and other items

loans.name: Cecilia Esther

texts.es: Cecilia es una microempresaria de 43 años, residente en un barrio del municipio de Cartagena de Indias ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar y a causa de su extrema pobreza una cuñada le ofreció hospedaje en su vivienda y al mismo tiempo para lograr tener su medio de sustento le propuso colocar una tienda de víveres y abarrotes en esta localidad, por no existir una en las cercanías.  Gracias a todo el apoyo recibido, Cecilia logró tener éxito en su negocio en el que diariamente realiza ventas de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar a la comunidad, ella comercializa un variado grupo de productos víveres, verduras, carnes, productos de aseo y mecatos en su local que abre a partir de las 6 a.m. y finaliza su día a las 8 p.m.  En la actualidad desea ampliar su surtido y para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en mucho más surtido de víveres al por mayor; arroz, legumbres, azúcar, aceite y productos de aseo, con lo que obtendrá una reducción significativa en los costos de los productos.  Cecilia es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales tan solo uno es menor de edad y aún depende económicamente de ella y de su cónyuge.  Su meta a futuro es realizar adecuaciones al local con la finalidad de tener un mayor surtido.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 43-year-old micro entrepreneur. She lives in a neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias, Bolívar department. She lived in extreme poverty, so her sister offered her accomodation where she lives. At the same time, with the intention to have a source of sustenance, she suggested her to open a grocery store, seeing that there were not such businesses in the area.

Thanks to all the support she has received, Cecilia has a successful business, where she sells essential products to her community every day. She sells a wide variety of products, such as vegetables, different types of meat, hygiene products, and snacks in her store, opening at 6:00 am, and closing at 8:00 pm.

She wants to sell a wider variety of products, which is why she is applying for a CrediKiva from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy supplies in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, sugar, cooking oil, and hygiene products. This will result in better prices for her.

Cecilia is the mother of five children; only one of them is underage and still depends on her and her partner. Her goal for the future is to make some improvements to her establishment with the intention to be able to store more products.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, sugar, cooking oil, and hygiene products.

loans.name: Zhiyde

texts.ru: Жийде успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 6 коров, 6 овец. Также выращивает пшеницу и ячмень на 9,60 Га земли. Хозяйство развито, поэтому ежемесячный доход составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жийде вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока, часть средств направит на приобретение сена в качестве корма для скота на зимний период. Таким образом она сохранит поголовье и сможет развить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zhiyde successfully repaid her previous loan, having used it as intended. She is extremely grateful to Kiva and everyone who contributed to her financing. Today she owns six cows and six sheep, and also grows wheat and barley on 9.60 hectares of land. The growth of her farm has allowed her monthly income to reach around 22,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Zhiyde came to Bai Tushum Bank again to ask for a 110,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk she sells. Part of the funds will go toward buying hay to feed the livestock during winter. This way she can keep her animals and expand her work.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of her organic milk sales and to buy hay to feed her livestock.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
A mother blessed with two schoolchildren living in Tbaung Khmum province, Sat is 44 years old. She has grown cassava and rice to earn income for her living condition for 20 years. She can save from her daily income about 3.5 USD per day for her family.Las year,her crop was destroyed by insects, which it was her main challenge.

For Sat, this is her first time with VisionFund and she leads a group of two to ask for this loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer to input her farmland to produce more yields. She hopes that she can get good yield from her farm to improve her living condition and support on her children’s studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to input on her farmland in order to increase productivity of her crop yield.

loans.name: Lucila De Jesus

texts.es:
Lucila, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura. 

Lucila, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio se lo enseño su pareja, juntos trabajan durante la mañana en las parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas, para vender leche entre los vecinos y alrededores de donde residen.

Lucila, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca que le ayudara a producir más leche para empezar a producir lácteos.

Lucila, sueña con comprar más ganado y comprar un terreno para poder pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
44-year-old Lucila went to school until the 9th grade. She has a partner who works in agriculture.

Lucila also works in agriculture. Her partner taught her this occupation. They work together in the morning in the fields and milk the cows in the afternoon. They sell the milk to their neighbors and in the surrounding areas.

Lucila needs this loan to buy a cow, which will help her produce more milk to begin preparing dairy products. 

Lucila dreams of buying more cattle and a piece of pasture land for her animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mimo Group

texts.en:
Mariam is the featured borrower in Mimo group and she joined with with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends and work hard to develop their families living.

Mariam is a 29-year-old married mother of one girl, who has been working in a printing company since 2005, to support her husband in their living.
Her limited income combined with her husband's lead her to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's school tuition fees.

She hopes to stay capable of educating her daughter and developing her family's living.
Mariam is the lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Zeinab is at the center, while Fadia is the lady at the far right side with white Jacket.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is married and the mother of five children. She describes herself as patient and earns a living on a farm where she raises dairy cows. She has been in this line of work for five years and operates her business in a good location where most of her customers are locals. She describes her biggest challenge as a shortage of funds and has requested a Kes 60,000 loan to buy two more dairy cows. Her goal for the future is to have enough money to educate her children. This is her second loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. She successfully repaid her previous one.

loans.use: to buy two more dairy cows

loans.name: Carie Ann

texts.en:
She is Carie Ann, 36 years old, married to Sherwin, a tricycle driver, and they have four children. Carie Ann has been operating this variety store for almost three years. Lately she added sacks of feed for hogs and chicken that required her to advance considerable amount of capital. Her new business is currently stabilizing from its start-up costs, while her old business, the sari-sari, is facing stiff competition within their area in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte.

Now she is struggling in this period of adjustment because she almost emptied her capital. She has to acquire additional capital to continuously operate her sari-sari with sufficient stocks and also reserve some amount for retailing of animal feeds. A loan worth PhP 25,000 would be very helpful for her. She can use this capital wisely to generate more income and savings. She will use it to buy additional supplies for her store and sacks of animal feeds. She hopes that her family’s resources would be enough to provide their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She wants them to complete their schooling and gain stable jobs someday.

She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her store and sacks of animal feeds to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs to enable her to increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en: Winrose is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells photography items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of photography items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of photography items.

loans.name: Kakei

texts.ru: Какей, 60 лет, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Какей среднее образование, она на пенсии, также занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 35 овец. Откармливают скот на пастбищах. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Какей решила и дальше развивать свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец с целью разведения и увеличения поголовья, а также наращения прибыли. Доходы от кредита Какей будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Kakei is sixty years old and married, and her children are grown and independent. Kakei has a secondary education and is now retired, although she also farms. She currently has 35 sheep, which are raised on pasture. Her monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS). Kakei decided to expand her business so she asked Bai Tushum Bank for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy sheep. Her goal is to expand the herd she raises, and also to augment her income. Income from use of the loan will be used to improve the farm, as well as to save money to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to add to her livestock

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga fue víctima del conflicto armado en su región y para salvaguardar su integridad y la de su familia, salió desplazada de sus tierras en compañía de su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, tras esta difícil situación contaron con el apoyo del gobierno nacional que les otorgó una vivienda en una urbanización del municipio de Cartagena de Indias ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar en donde pudieron establecer una nueva vida e iniciar su proyecto de negocio una tienda de víveres.     Al ser Olga una señora de avanzada edad, decidió entregarle este negocio a uno de sus hijos para que le ofreciera una mejor administración y con ello obtuviera un mejor ingreso.  Diariamente el negocio abre a partir de las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 10 p.m. un horario muy amplio para cumplir con su meta y garantizar excelentes ingresos, en la actualidad Olga desea que su negocio tenga un excelente surtido y por ello está aplicando a un credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en mucho más surtido de víveres; arroz, legumbres, azúcar, aceite y productos de aseo, así podrá adquirir una nueva gama de productos que aún no oferta, lo que le mejorará su variedad.  Su meta a futuro es mantener un surtido con el que pueda competir con negocios de la zona.
texts.en:
Olga was a victim of the armed conflict in her region. To safeguard her physical integrity and that of her family, she left her land with her partner and their four children. After that difficult situation, they they received the support of the national government, which provided them with a home in the city of Cartagena de Indias, where they started a new life and their convenience store. 

Since Olga is an older woman, she decided to give the business to one of her sons, who could manage it better and obtain a higher income. The business opens daily at 6:00 a.m. and closes at 10:00 p.m. It has a wide schedule to guarantee excellent earnings. Olga currently wishes for her business to have an excellent availability of products. This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundations. She will invest in a wider supply of products, such as rice, oil and cleaning products. This will allow her to have a range of products that she currently does not sell. Her future goal is to keep her varied supply in order to compete with other businesses in the area.

loans.use: to stock products such as rice, vegetables, sugar, oil and cleaning products.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
She is Marites, a business woman who is committed on her goals. Currently, she’s running a buy and sell business of different frozen products. The business that she has right now became a way for her to provide income for her family. She has the business for five years and earning for about Php 12,000 each month. She’s from Tondo Manila, Philippines and enjoys taking care of her family while doing the business.

Each day is tiring, since dealing with different kinds of people and change of weather needs to be considered as well. However, she remains persistent in running the business and earn more profit as she has faith for God’s provision. She also considered becoming a part of CCT as an advantage because of the privileges that she has been acquiring as a member. For now, she decided to apply for an Php 8,000 loan as she needs additional capital for her business. Through this amounts, she’ll be able to buy frozen products such as sausages and hotdogs. She dreams of having the business expanded someday where she can offer not just retail but bulk orders to clients.  

Despite of being busy managing the business, Marites  spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products such as frozen meats, chicken, pork and stocks of noodles, Fruit juices and rice.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is the age of 33 and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a barber by profession and owns a hair dressing shop. He has been working 6 years ago to meet the family’s expenses. He wants to improve the hair salon for a proper income.

Tasleem’s husband wants to buy equipment like a barber's chair, hair dryer, hairbrush, comb, saloon mirror, barber towel etc. for proper income, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this salon equipment. Therefore Tasleem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Tasleem and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband's hair salon.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is 49 years old and the mother of three children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a medical clinic where she provides first-aid services. She has been practicing as a nurse in a hospital where she worked with many pregnancies and successful operations and now wants to take advantage of her experience. She is a very well-known nurse in her area and women have full confidence in her abilities. Zahida is requesting this loan to buy medicines, drips, injections, and other items for her clinic so she can provide good service to her patients. Her goal is to make enough money to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: to buy medicines, drips, injections, and other items for her medical clinic.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 33, 21, 18 años de edad, todos están acompañados.

Benilda, tiene una venta de tortillas desde hace 7 años, antes trabajaba en el campo como jornalero, pero luego tuvo la idea de colocar su propio negocio, porque en el caserío donde ella vive no había venta de tortillas cerca, pero además se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos en donde le ayudan sus hijos en la agricultura y en la venta de tortillas, el horario de la venta de tortillas es de 6:00 a.m. a 9:00 am. y de 4:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m. de domingo a domingo.

Benilda, necesita el préstamo para comprar 8 sacos de maíz y 6 quintales de fertilizantes.

El sueño de Benilda, es poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Benilda is 55 years old. She studied until the sixth grade. She is single. She has three children of 33, 21, and 18 years of age. All of them are accompanied.

Benilda has been selling tortillas for seven years. She used to work in the field as a day laborer, but then had the idea of starting her own business because in the village where she lives no tortillas were being sold nearby. But she also works planting basic grains helping her children in agriculture, and in the sale of tortillas. The schedule of selling tortillas is from 6:00am until 9:00am and from 4:00pm until 6:00pm from Sunday to Sunday.

Benilda needs a loan to buy 8 bags of corn and 6 quintals of fertilizer.

Benilda’s dream is to be able to improve her housing.

loans.use: to buy 8 bags of corn and 6 quintals of fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila, 62 years old, is from San Miguel, Bohol. All her nine children are grown. Leonila learned farming because of the need to help raise her children when they were still young. She also raises hogs. These have been her source of income for 19 years now. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer and feed. Leonila is determined to keep her business because it will keep her occupied and she will live with a purpose. Her income will be for her family’s daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru:
Убайдулло опытный бизнесмен. Он образованный человек. Убайдулло в университете учился на отлично. Сейчас он имеет свой собственный и постоянный бизнес. Убайдулло занимается торговлей деятельности. У него есть магазин, где он продает продукт питания. Убайдулло  в магазине продает напитки, молочные продукты, масло, печенье, конфеты, макароны, сыр, колбасы и другие продукты питания.  Он хорошо знает свою работу. 
Убайдулло живет в городе Душанбе. Он женат и имеет одного сына. У семьи Убайдулло еще есть бизнес, который его брат занимается перевозом  крупных товаров. Они все умные, трудолюбивые, честные люди. Убайдулло просит кредит для расширения торговлей деятельности, и увеличить товарооборот. За счет кредита он планирует, перевозит больше ассортимент продукт питания. Убайдулло очень нужно Ваша поддержка.
texts.en:
Ubaydullo is an experienced businessman. He is a well educated person, having received excellent grades at university. Now he owns his own sales business: a grocery store. He sells drinks, dairy products, butter, cookies, candy, noodles, cheese, sausage, and other foods. He knows his work well.

Ubaydullo lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is married and has a son. There is an additional business in Ubaydullo's family - his brother has a business in transporting large goods. His family is full of smart, hardworking, honest people. Ubaydullo is asking for a loan to expand his sales. He plans to use the loan to bring in a greater variety of food goods. Ubaydullo very much needs your help.

loans.use: increase his sales volume and bring in a broader assortment of goods.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is married and the mother of three children. She describes herself as honest and operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes. She has been in this business for five years and works in a busy place where most of her customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as changes in the weather which affect the supply of available vegetables. She will use this Kes 100,000 loan to buy more tomatoes to sell. Her business goal is to own a truck that she can use for transportation within five years. She will use the profits she expects to earn to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains, shoes, drinks. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 98,000 loan to buy more stock of curtains. Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of curtains

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
Omar, de 30 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta noveno, vive junto a su esposa e hijo.
 
Omar, junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y ahora lo desempeña como fuente de ingresos, él trabaja durante la mañana en sus propios cultivos y en la tarde trabaja en otras parcelas ajenas, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar el ganado. 

Omar, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca que le ayudara en un futuro a incrementar la producción de leche para vender y obtener ingresos adicionales.

Omar, sueña con comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Omar is 30 years old, married, studied until 9th grade, and lives with his wife and son.

Omar, together with his wife, earns his living by farming. He learned this work with his parents and now does it to generate income. He works with his own crops in the mornings, and in the afternoons works in other people's fields. Meanwhile, his wife takes care of their home and their livestock.

Omar needs a loan to buy a cow that will help him in the future to increase the amount of milk they produce to sell and earn additional income.

Omar dreams of buying a piece of pasture land for his animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Lino is a farmer. He grows and sells sili (chili peppers). He is 56 years old married man with three children from Clarin, Bohol. He has been engaged in farming for a year ago. His oldest child was 20 while the youngest is 15.
Aside from farming, he has also other source of income being a contractor of a certain company.

A loan of 6,000 PHP will help him to purchase fertilizers and pesticide. Thus, it could improve the yield of his farm and give him encouragement to continue to work hard to become sustainable.


In the future, Lino would like to expand to his livelihood to improve the living condition of the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticide

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from the village of Pagadian City. She is 45 years old, married, and has school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector in rice production, selling her own harvested rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2010, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase bags of fertilizers for rice production. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 60 and a widow in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day she never gets tired tending her store. Carmelita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without record of default.

Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory means income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ruby

texts.en: Maria Ruby is 48 years old, married and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she is given priority in receiving financial services designed to improve her present conditions, including financial literacy and other trainings. She has actively participated in these sessions and seen positive changes in her living conditions from the moment she signed up for membership with the cooperative. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, and bamboo as well as a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy boat-making materials such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, and bamboo as well as an engine and fishing nets.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and buy land. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She also sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of cosmetic products. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products to sell. Her business goal is to open other business branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 54-year-old entrepreneur who started running her own variety (or sari-sari) store thirty years ago. She is grateful to have her business because she was able to support her family. Maria is also thankful for the support which the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) offers. Aside from financial help, aspiring entrepreneurs like her are also provided with lectures and seminars on how to improve their entrepreneurship. She is working hard because she wants to support her children in school and provide an abundant life to them. She decided to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 to have more groceries to sell in her variety store. She dreams of making her business grow.

Maria regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, business experience and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members who gather weekly to study religion, build social capital and learn about running a business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Sitan est celle au bout  tenant dans ses mains la tache contenant les légumes.
Sitan est une femme mariée, résidant au Mali, âgée de 30 ans et mère de 03 enfants,  dont 02 sont scolarisés,  et un se trouve actuellement à la maternelle.  Ils sont  âgées de 14 à 05 ans. Sitan  est analphabète. Son mari est un commerçant. Elle rêve d’avoir une indépendance dans son activité, pour des raisons de financement elle a eu des difficultés, des soucis qui l’empêche d’être prospère dans son commerce, donc c’est suite à se désagrément qu’elle a  fait une demande de prêt auprès de l’IMF envie d’acheter  plus d’aliment de cuisson tel que : pomme de terre, banane platine, oignons, huile. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans à Bamako. Après avoir la  bonne cuisson elle  les vend en milieu rural tout en réalisant un gain de 100000f CFA par cycle l’ intérêt  l’aideras a couvrir les charges de sa famille. elle est souvent confronté à des obstacles tel que la chute des prix et les insectes malveillantes qui détruisent ses pommes de terre.
texts.en:
Sitan is the one on the end, holding a basin containing vegetables in her hands. She is a married woman, living in Mali, aged 30 and the mother of three children of whom two are enrolled in school and one presently in kindergarten. They range in age from 15 to 5 years old.

Sitan is illiterate. Her husband is a small-scale retailer. She dreams of having some independence in her activity. Due to financial concerns she has had difficulties, worries which keep her from prospering in her business. So because of these issues she has requested a loan from the microfinance institution, wishing to buy more cooking ingredients such as potatoes, plantains, onions, and oil.

Sitan buys her wares in Bamako. After cooking them well, she sells them in rural areas making a profit of 100,000 f CFA per loan cycle. This profit will help her to cover family expenses. She is often confronted with issues such as a drop in prices and nefarious insects that destroy her potatoes.

loans.use: to buy some vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de materiales de construcción. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda la mercadería. Actualmente la ropa que vende rota constantemente y necesita incrementar su mercadería, “necesito un préstamo para comprar ropa por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa es de bajo precio, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de ropa por mayor. Su sueño es vender ropa por mayor, ella desea incrementar su mercadería comprando ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Filomena solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor.
texts.en:
Filomena continues with her business of selling second hand clothing. The previous loan that she received was invested in buying construction materials. She made her payments punctually because she was able to sell all of the merchandise.
Currently, the clothing that she sells is constantly running out and she needs to increase her merchandise. "I need a loan to buy clothing wholesale in order to improve my earnings" she comments.
The advantage of her business is that the clothing is low cost and the disadvantage is that she lacks the finances to buy clothing wholesale.
Her dream is to sell clothing wholesale, she wants to increase her merchandise by buying second hand clothing wholesale. This is the second loan she has received from the institution in the 20 years that she has been working in this activity.
It is for these reasons that Filomena is requesting a loan to buy second hand clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn has been doing good in her retailing business in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old, married with 2 school age children.


Ednalyn wants to make used the fortune she is having now that she wants to build a concrete house that she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount shall be used to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, hollow blocks and galvanized iron sheets.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, hollow blocks and galvanized iron sheets

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 74 years old, widow and lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC and has access to the perks of membership. She had availed  various loan products way back before and successfully repaid without defaults. Now that she needs an amount to pay for a medical check up and purchase maintenance medicines, she asks for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up and purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 53 years old, a widow with 5 adult age children. She owns a parcel of land that she cultivates for rice production business in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. In need of additional capital for her business, she asks from Paglaum MPC to pay for land preparation such as plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation and purchase of bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation such as plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation and purchase of bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a hardworking farmer in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She cultivates her own parcel of land and continuously produce bulk of rice for local consumption. To augment her rice production business, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation & purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation & purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in  a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of products for salon use. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, She will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products for salon use.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys the perks of membership. She had availed various loan products and successfully repaid without records of default. She is grateful to the cooperative because she can always turn to it for any financial needs. Currently, she asks for a loan to pay for medical check up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up and purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a transport business where he transports ustomers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel prices. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a motorvehicle within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be peaceful. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes,onions. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. She will use the Kes 99,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes,onions. Her business goal is to be  a supplier of vegetables within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes,onions

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a home and educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low rain which affects supply of animal feeds. She will use the Kes 98,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to have more milk production within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more cows . This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en: Cesaria has very high interest in doing business and she has been involving in business activities since 2003, with her own working capital of $1000.00 and she makes her best on it. She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital because her capital is not enough. She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including aqua, slippers, rice, cooking oils, sweets, sardines, biscuits, ice, candles, coffee, snacks and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. With this loan she still wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy aqua, slippers, rice, cooking oils, sweets, sardines, biscuits, ice, candles, coffee, snack’s, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a 46-year-old married man with two children ages 5 and 17 years old respectively. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household commodities like biscuits, eggs, powdered milk, coffee, seasonings, candies, shampoo, toothpaste and soft drinks.

He has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy supplies like canned goods, condiments, beverages and toiletries. It would help boost the inventory of his store and he would be able to maintain the flow of his daily income. He could provide his family with basic needs and be able to pay his obligations as well.

Virgilio hopes that his sari-sari (variety) store will become productive.

loans.use: to buy supplies like canned goods, condiments, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be honest and reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, bread, eggs, cooking oil, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and other items. His business goal is to open a wholesale business within 5 years. he will use the anticipated profits to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Dorrice

texts.en:
Dorrice is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 51,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big grocery within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with one child. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more timber. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Rokeyyas

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kratie province’s Kratie district, Rokeyyas is now 32 years old and married. She has 2 children; one is too young for school while the other one is in school. Rokeyyas and her husband are farmers who grow cassava as their main business to support the family. They supplement the family’s income by selling grocery items. Together, they have been in business for 14 years.

This is the first loan for Rokeyyas with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland and also use a portion of it to lease a plot of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a married man. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, bread,eggs, cooking oil, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and other items. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. he will use the anticipated profits to build his house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and other items

loans.name: Som Ouk's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kratie province’s Snoul district, Som Ouk is now 33 years old and married. She has three children. Som Ouk and her husband grow cassava and sometimes they sell snacks for a living. They have been engaged in their business for 10 years.

Som Ouk is a second cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and generate more income for her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her cassava. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to grow healthier cassava to make more income.
