loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her cassava

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 18 years old. He is a single man who resides in the Steung Meanchey district of Phnom Penh city. He is a student who has qualified for a nine month internship abroad. He is going to receive an amount of money, which allow him to save about 8 USD each day.

Due to not having enough funds, he is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to prepare some important documents such as his passport, visa and study tools to make his internship more convenient.

He hopes to gain more experience and improve his skills to pave the way for him to get a good job.

loans.use: to prepare important documents such as a passport, visa and study tools to make his internship more convenient.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania hails from the town of Tagbilaran City, Bohol.  She is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 13 and the youngest is 2 months old.
She operates a tricycle (a motorcycle with side car). She earns out of the rent from that business.
 Her husband's occupation is an electrician and plumber as well.

She is asking for a loan to purchase spare parts, tires, fuel and lubricants. These will help improve its speed and enable good condition of the vehicle. With these, more passengers will be attracted to ride and it will provide a safe ride to every passenger.  With these, Epifania's income will improve, and she could provide healthy diets to the whole family.

In the future,  Epifania  would like to expand her tricycle transportation services   to improve the family's living condition and  also establish a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tires, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 38 years old. She is known in the Calamba area for her farming activities. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Devie Gran

texts.en:
Devie Gran has a banana farm in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is her primary source of income for her family.

She makes it a point to have good land preparation in order to have maximum yield and receive a good income.

Recently, she needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs, so she requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).

Devie Gran wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor for irrigation.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a married man. He operates a retail business where he offers photocopying, printing services. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock . He will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy printing, photocopying papers. His business goal is to he will expand business within 5 years. This is his fourth  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: buy printing, photocopying papers

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She also offers photocopy services. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add M-pesa float. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float.

loans.name: Felimona

texts.en: Felimona wants to head up for the next cropping season that she's busy in attending her rice field. She provides the needs of her family through this farming activity and had obtained financial access from Paglaum MPC. She managed her account with the cooperative without default payments. Recently, she asked for a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for labor costs in land preparation such as plowing, harrowing, leveling and seedbed preparation and to purchase of bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in land preparation such as plowing, harrowing, leveling and seedbed preparation and to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Floreli

texts.en:
Floreli is 52 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Floreli is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Floreli has been in this business for 11 years and earns additional income from a general store and fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a determined man of 34, he is married and has a 3-year-old child. Isaac has been running his money transfer business in one of the townships called Zingalume in Lusaka, Zambia since November, 2014. He is requesting for a loan in order to purchase the two trading kiosk which he is currently using and to provide the funds needed to serve customers. The loan will also be used to employ one person to help serve customers faster.

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, do not have bank accounts. Distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Zoona is a company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction services by propagating an open network using small businesses called Agents. Isaac is one of the Agents, he earns a profit for every transaction that he makes at the kiosks.

This is his story: When Isaac first started his business his main focus was to get people in his community to know about the service that he provides. He started off by doing direct sales to customers in his community by distributing flyers and explaining his business to them in person. His strategy paid off because barely a month later his transactions had increased from a mere 10 transactions a day to 30 transactions a day. He then set up his second outlet and because of the quick growth of his business he faces the challenge of working float (electronic and cash value of his working capital) which means he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers from time to time. He frequently has to close his shops and make trips to the bank to convert his electronic money to cash and vice versa.

Isaac is certain that purchasing his trading kiosks so that he can own them and the capital injection in his business will help him grow his business and earn more profits. The profits will help him to provide basic needs for his family, as the business is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy two Zoona trading kiosks and provide financial services needed by the 10 million people in Zambia without bank accounts and to make jobs.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old and is one of two children in his family. He helps his parents support their family financially. Henry works full time in the field of Information Technology. He has decided to open his own Zoona business in a quest to increase his income. Henry is an aspiring entrepreneur and is very driven by the opportunities afforded to him through his Zoona business. He particularly enjoys offfering service to people in his community from a variety of backgrounds. Henry’s Zoona business brings financial services to people in his community who previously had to travel longer distances in order to send or receive money. One of the challenges Henry faces is that he currently does not own the trading booth that he is using to serve customers.

Henry is requesting a loan in order to purchase a trading kiosk, owning his own Kiosk will help Henry save on operational costs. Henry's dream is to grow his business so that it can provide him with increased income to support himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona trading kiosk, to facilitate local money transfers and support his family.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 47 years old, he is married and has three children ages 21, 17 and 12.All his children go to school. His eldest is pursuing an undergraduate degree. Kenneth is a trained accountant and has over 20 years experience. He left formal employment in 2009 to pursue private business in financial services.

Kenneth's Zoona business deals in the sending and receiving of money from one place to the other. People in Lumumba, Lusaka go to his shop to access financial services such as bill payments, forex and mobile money transfers. He explains that it brings him joy to provide high level technological services to the community at affordable rates. His vision is to bring as many services as possible under one roof.

Kenneth has requested a Kiva loan so that he can have the funds needed to service his customers, who need to access financial services. His biggest challenge is that he lacks a good working capital and struggles to serve his customers as fast as he would like. His is hopeful that this capital injection will enable him earn more profits. With the profits, the profits go towards insuring that his children stay in school. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide the funds needed to serve customers who need to send and receive money from his shop and to pay for signage.

loans.name: Mwape

texts.en:
Mwape is 30 years old. He is married and has two children, 1-year-old Chishimba and 3-year-old Misheck. Mwape works hard to provide for his family. 

Mwape completed secondary school and college before accounting and budgeting. He has since started his own Zoona business. Mwape enjoys his business because it allows him to gain invaluable experience in customer service matters, and it gives the people in his community access to financial services without any barriers. 

Mwape is requesting a loan in order to expand his business from one outlet to two and bring financial services to more communities. He described himself as a driven and hardworking man who dreams of achieving success in business in order to further support his family and his children’s education.

When Mwape receives this loan, he will be able to purchase two trading booths, one small and one big. The trading booths will be placed in two different spots; the big booth will go to Ndola town, where there is more traffic, and he will place the small one in Luanshya, which is a smaller town compared to Ndola. Mwape has done a lot of market research and is confident of the two locations where he wants to expand his business. Opening these two locations will enable Mwape to hire two new people to help him run the outlets.

This loan means a lot to Mwape. It will give him the chance to grow

loans.use: to purchase two trading booths and serve people who need to access Zoona financial services in Luanshya and Ndola.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John from Lusaka, Zambia, feels very blessed for the tremendous support from Kiva lenders who have helped him develop and run a mobile money transfer business to earn income for him and his family. He works very hard and can be found at his green trading booths every day from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. John is 37 years old; he is married and has three children.

John has been running his business for three years. He is a mobile money transfer agent; this means that for every transaction that John makes, he earns a profit. He currently operates three mobile money transfer outlets within Lusaka, and has employed three people to help him with the day-to-day running of the business. Through running this business, John has been able to take his children to school and pay for rent, as he lives in a rented house. The business has also helped him to furnish his house, and this makes him proud. John would like to take this opportunity to let his lenders know that he has fully repaid his last two loans.

He is now requesting another loan so that he can continue to grow his business by opening up another mobile money outlet. He will use the funds to buy a trading kiosk and serve people who need to access financial services in Chazanga compound, where he is going to set up the new kiosk. Once he sets up another kiosk, John will be able to employ one more person. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their help in providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy a trading kiosk and serve people who need to access financial services in Lusaka's Chazanga compound

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 24 years old. He earns his living by providing mobile money transfers in the city of Livingstone, Zambia. He lives in a rented house alone. Christopher relocated from his hometown of Lusaka upon completing his education in search of employment opportunities. He comes from a family of three. Christopher's days are spent serving customers and running up and down to the bank so that he can satisfy his customers. When he makes his bank runs, he has to close his trading booth as he currently works alone. This saddens him as he misses out on profits if sometimes he is not able to serve his customers at their time of need. This situation becomes worse when the bank closes as he cannot send any working capital that he has to the bank to convert it to cash.

Christopher is taking out this loan so that he can increase his working capital and serve more customers conveniently. This loan will also be used to pay for the trading booth that he is currently using. Serving more customers will mean he will be able to earn more profits. He is very excited about the future prospects of growing his business.

loans.use: to increase his working capital for financial services and purchase a Zoona trading booth to ensure he never has to turn away customers.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Lusaka. He works as an accountant and operates his own mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to many unbanked individuals. People in his community go to his outlet to send and receive money as well as pay bills. He is married and has no children.

Noah started running his own business so that he could increase his revenue stream and offer employment to the youths in his community. He currently employs one person who works at his shop. Noah has requested for a loan so that he can grow his business by adding more money in his business and purchasing some paint so that he can attract more people and serve them. This will ensure that customers are not turned away when they need to transact large amounts of money.

Noah explains that the business of mobile money is highly dependent on how much money is in the business to service customers. Noah would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for financing business ventures like his. He looks forward to more engagement with the lenders through his updates.

loans.use: to have the funds needed to serve people who need to access Zoona financial services in his community and also buy paint to improve the appearance of his office.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 32-year-old micro-entrepreneur. He is married and lives in a rented house in Lusaka, Zambia. He operates a mobile money business that serves the needs of his community by providing financial services. The business is Henry's only source of income.

Henry is requesting a loan to grow his business so that he can open another Zoona mobile money transfer outlet and serve more customers. He would like to let his lenders know that his past two loans have enabled him to expand from one shop to three in his town of Lusaka. He is now able to serve many more customers. This is good for customers as well as Henry because his income has increased. He explains that his personal life has improved with this business growth as.he is able to manage his home and has managed to use some of the profits from his business to furnish his house. Henry has fully repaid his last two loans.

This loan will be used to expand his business by opening a fourth shop in Lusaka's Mandevu compound . He has seen the need for another shop with customer demand. Many people enjoy the service of being able to easily send and receive money. Henry would like to thank lenders for believing in him and allowing him to grow his business and improve his life through access to capital.

loans.use: to purchase a banded Zoona mobile money trading booth where he will operate his new location

loans.name: Sausten

texts.en:
Sausten is a hardworking man in Petauke, Zambia who has spent the last six years in the mobile money industry providing financial services to people in his community. He is a 59-year-old widower with seven children. Six of his children are in school and his eldest son Ben helps him run the business.

Sausten supports his family through his Zoona mobile money transfer business, as it is his main source of income. Sausten is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can expand his business by adding another mobile money outlet. He has found a place in Nyimba where he would like to open another mobile money transfer outlet. He is excited to be expanding to the new location as this will help him to increase the number of outlets and earn more profits. The anticipated increase in profits will be used to buy a small piece of land where Sausten intends to start growing maize crops.

Sausten's dream is to keep expanding his business so that his children can have a stable future and in the near future, take over the business. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support and help in educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, so that he can open another outlet to continue expanding his business.

loans.name: Muong Phang 35 Group

texts.en:
Chuong, 37, is a Thai ethnic lady who is married and has two children, a boy aged 17 and a girl aged 14. She lives with her husband and her children in a traditional Thai ethnic house in a remote village. Chuong and her husband work very hard at agricultural production to provide for the children. They cultivate rice, breed pigs, buffalo, chicken, duck and fish.

This is the first time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food to feed the pigs and chickens she is raising. She hopes that this investment will help her reap good benefits, especially with the technical support of the Program's agricultural workers.

Chuong dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her children. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food to feed the pigs and chickens that she raises.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 25, single and has a small cattle fattening project. His father is on pension and his monthly pension income is very small and can barely cover the family's expenses.

Mustafa previously requested a loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales of cheese, milk and butter and also afford his marriage expenses.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andhuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Andahuaylillas y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Manuela ella es casada y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y cuyes y alimentos para los pollos y cuyes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de , negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: These are members of the VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO communal bank located in the Andhuaylillas district and province, within the Cusco department. Manuela is married, is 60 years old, and has three children. She works raising chickens and Guinea pigs, fattens them up, and sells them at the various markets. She’s been doing this for several years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her chickens and Guinea pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and Guinea pigs and feed. The borrowers that are added to the group photo took their photos after the meeting because they got permission to miss it due to work. The other members sell animals, groceries, and stationary goods. She is grateful to those who form a part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens, Guinea pigs, and feed.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon is a confident man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. He is living in a small city with his family. He is married and has three children. He works at a closed stock company as an accountant and cashier.

His elder son is studying abroad at medical university. He wants to be a specialist of medical business. He studies with excellent and good marks. He wants to return home and work to help the residents and his country.

Odiljon wants to help to his son to achieve his goal. He is requesting a loan from Kiva and IMON to pay his son’s tuition fee of studies. He awaits Kiva lenders kindness and wishes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee for his studies in Medicine.

loans.name: Roberto Jr.

texts.en:
Roberto is 25-year-old-man from Mahaplag, Leyte. He is married and his children are four, two and six months old.

Roberto raised his family by selling barbecue to the community. He has done this for a year. He is asking for a loan to have additional capital to buy chicken wings, legs, liver, and intestines, pork, and hotdogs.

In the future, he wishes to improve her business to earn a better livelihood.

loans.use: to buy chicken wings, legs, liver, and intestines, pork and hotdogs.

loans.name: N03Th5Hyênhtrung Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhu is 53 years old and she is married.
She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 10 years.
Nhu lives in Ha Trung district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on poultry happens, they could die so she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.
The main hardship that Nhu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
This is Nhu first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard.
She is the group leader of N03Th5HYênHTrung, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Nhu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is an active member of Paglaum MPC, who enjoys all the perks of membership. She is 59 years old and married with adult age children. Lolita is busy running her fishing operations and tilling their own land, with both business ventures supported by the coop. She said she's secured financially knowing she can always turn to the cooperative, but she wants to be prepared also for unprecedented life events so she also avails herself of life insurance from the coop. Now that her one year life insurance is expiring, she wants a loan in an amount to pay for the life insurance renewal for the family. Lolita believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held by the neck for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for the life insurance renewal for the family.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Noraina

texts.en: Noraina has always had the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Pagadian City and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Noraina knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Noraina hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Prize Winners Self Help Group

texts.en:
The gentleman in the photo is Jeremiah, 39 years old. He is married and has four children, who are all in school. He joined Hand in Hand in the year 2012 and has benefited from all the training, especially on enterprise and financial management.

Jeremiah is involved in vegetable, maize and dairy farming. He has applied for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase production yields. He anticipates that this will help him sell more and met his customers' demands. This will help him earn more income.

Jeremiah is very happy and grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their help and support and promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be generous. He operates a motorcycle repair business. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be few repair tools. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy motorcycle repair tools. He hopes that in the future, he will be an employer. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle repair tools

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married and has been a fish retailer for a long period of time. This business activity has given her enough proceeds for her family needs. She successfully rolled her initial capital of PHP 1,500 and managed to acquire a market stall. She needs additional capital for expansion so she is asking Paglaum MPC for an amount to purchase fish in bulk for retail.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk for retail.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like cement and wood and pay for labor on renovation

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
Santos, de 29 años de edad, está casado, su esposa trabaja en casa criando gallinas y cerdos, pero también tiene una mini tienda en su casa, tienen dos hijos.

Santos, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo y el lugar donde cultiva es alquilado, la distancia que recorre es de 10 minutos a pie y cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno; aparte de eso también se dedica a la pesca y tiene cuatro años de realizar esta actividad.- Cuando los trabajos de la agricultura se terminan, su fuente de ingreso principal es la pesca, él sale por las noches a pescar y por la mañana realiza la venta en las casa de su comunidad.
	
Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para colocar una tienda y la otra parte de dinero será para la agricultura.

Santos, espera seguir trabajando y lograr sacar adelante sus hijos para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Santos is 29 years old. He is married and his wife works at home raising chickens and pigs, but they also have a small store in their house. They have two children.
Santos works in agriculture, specifically growing corn, beans and soy beans. The land that he cultivates is rented. The distance he covers is 10 minutes on foot and he cultivates 7,000 square meters. In addition to this, he also works in fishing and has been doing this for four years.
When the agricultural work finishes, his main source of income is fishing. He goes out at night to fish and in the mornings he sells them from his house in the community.
Santos needs a loan to buy products to build a store and the other part of the money will be used for agriculture.
Santos hopes to continue working and to provide for his children so that they can be good people.

loans.use: to buy products to build a store and the other part of the money will be used for agriculture.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 22-year-old, She is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Fatima hopes to continue her education and improve her living.

loans.use: to pay for her  university tuition fees.

loans.name: Marleni Elizabeth

texts.es: Marleni tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su querido hijo de 8 años de edad a quien con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está sacando adelante en sus estudios, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, Marleni desde hace 3 años se ha dedicado a la fabricación de cepillos para lavar ropa que gracias a su trabajo es como lleva el sustento al hogar y buscando la manera de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica también a la fabricación de prendas de vestir para la cual es muy solicitada por sus vecinos y otras personas que gustan de sus servicios lo que le permite cada día tener mejores ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: agujas, aceites para la maquina, telas, pinzas, nylon, elástico, botones, zipper, hilos, carretes para tener otra mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marleni is 32 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her dear 8 year old son, who with much effort and sacrifice is getting ahead in his studies.
She is a very entrepreneurial woman. Marleni has worked for 3 years making brushes for washing clothing. Thanks to her work she is earning enough to support her home. In search for a way to maintain the economy of the home, she also works making articles of clothing, which are sought after by her neighbours and others who like her services. This allows her to to have a better income every day.
This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to invest in needles, oil for the machine, cloth, clothespins, nylon, elastics, buttons, zippers, and spools of thread to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in needles, oil for the machine, cloth, clothespins, nylon, elastics, buttons, zippers, and spools of thread to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Felena

texts.en:
Felena is 63 years old and married with adult children. For the past 30 years, she has been a rice farmer in the Philippines. Felena has been a member of PMPC for four years.

Felena is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is a 20-year-old woman who is a mother of two children, ages one and two. She and her family live in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. Noralyn earns a living by selling food in the communities while her husband works hard as a farmer. She and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their family and to sustain each day. 

Noralyn is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as spices, meat, cooking oil, and vegetables. In the future, she hopes to open a sari-sari (variety) store to enhance her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy spices, meat, cooking oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita is 46 years old. She is known in the Pagadian City area for her sari-sari (variety) store. Emerlita also actively participates in the services that PMPC offers. 

Emerlita is requesting a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to build a decent house. She hopes to maintain her PMPC membership in good standing with a good repayment record. In the future, Emerlita hopes to live comfortably. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what Emerlita is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to build her house

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 39 years old and married. For the past 10 years, she has been making hollow blocks with her husband. She makes a good profit and provides for her family.

Sally is requesting a loan to purchase bulk sand and bags of cement to make hollow blocks.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement to make hollow blocks

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, salt, flour, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a cereals store within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has always been an enthusiastic farmer. She is a rice farmer in Pagadian City and her land has yielded good earnings. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for land and seedbed preparations. She will use her loan to ensure that her rice field is ready for planting. Elizabeth knows that she has to get things right to earn more income for this cropping season. In the future, she hopes to buy a hauling truck to easily transport her produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Trinidad tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Trinidad borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Trinidad looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Miguela has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Miguela has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Miguela hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tatiana Margarita

texts.es: Tatiana es una ama de casa que aprovechó una oportunidad de negocio en su barrio ubicado en el municipio de Arjona, un vendedor que se estacionaba en frente de su vivienda comercializaba yuca y su cónyuge conocía de este negocio porque era quien le compraba el producto y en ocasiones le ayudaba.  Al pasar el tiempo el vendedor se fue a otro barrio y Tatiana decidió continuar con este negocio en la terraza de su vivienda y así mantener los clientes que llegaban a comprar y conseguir nuevos partiendo del excelente servicio que ella ofrece.  Diariamente a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. está dispuesta a atender a sus clientes, así mismo también vende en tiendas del sector y la mayor parte de sus ventas se genera de contado.  Como su capital no le es suficiente para su demanda está aplicando a un credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en volúmenes de yuca, que le permitan incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos.  Ella es madre de una niña de apenas tres años a quien le ha ofrecido bienestar con los frutos de su negocio, por eso considera que debe seguir creciendo en su negocio y adquirir una casa propia para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a housewife who took advantage of a business opportunity in her neighborhood located in the municipality of Arjona. A salesman parked in front of her home sold yucca, and her spouse knew about the business because he bought the product and helped the salesman on occasion.

After some time, the salesman went to another neighborhood, and Tatiana decided to continue the business from the terrace of her home. That way, she keeps the old customers who came to shop and gets new ones because of the excellent service she offers. Every day from 6 A.M. to 6 P.M. she is ready to serve customers, and she also sells from stores in the area; the majority of her sales are in cash.

Because her capital is not enough to meet the demand, she is applying for a Kiva loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which she will invest in quantities of yucca. This will let her increase her sales and income.

She is the mother of a girl barely three years old whom she takes care of with the fruits of her labor. That’s why she believes that she should keep expanding her business and get her own home to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in quantities of yucca

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, salt, flour, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with high demand for the products and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 37-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working as a beauty therapist for 12 years. Mirvat is a hard worker, who is wellknown in the region because of her good customer service and talent. She is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary tools and cosmetics, which will facilitate her work and allow her to provide her customers with better service.

She hopes to give her child the best education and good health. To accomplish this, she hopes to open a special wedding dresses shop, in addition to moving to a bigger working place, where she can expect a lot more customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and cosmetics to facilitate her work.

loans.name: Yaneth Irene

texts.es: Yaneth tiene 30 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos queridas hijas de 14 años y 7 años de edad a las que junto a su compañero de vida están sacando adelante en sus estudios, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde muy temprano anda en su actividad para desenvolverse en dicho negocio ya que demuestra su amabilidad hacia sus clientes. Yaneth se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 7 años en un lugar muy frecuente de personas en la comunidad. Yaneth desea comprar más materia prima para seguir en su negocio de tortillas y reparar su plancha donde elabora sus tortillas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: quintales de maíz, cal, y pagara mano de obra por la reparación de la plancha que le permite obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yaneth, age 30, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two beloved daughters, ages 14 and 7. Together with her life partner they are getting them ahead in their education. She is a very hard-working woman, who starts her business activity very early in order to advance in her business. She is kind to her customers.

Yaneth has been making and selling tortillas for seven years. She sells in a place that is highly traveled by people in the community.

Yaneth wishes to buy more raw material in order to continue with her tortilla business and to repair the grill where she makes the tortillas. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy corn in increments of 100 pounds, lime powder, and to pay for the labor to repair the grill. This will allow her to get better earnings and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 100 pound packages of corn, lime powder, and to pay for the labor to repair the grill that will allow her to get better earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Farming has been the life of Violeta had spent her lifetime into farming. She had mastered the craft in farming from land preparation, seed bed preparation, sowing, replanting, pre-harvest and post-harvest management and operation. She's been doing well with this activities and had generated income enough to send all her children to school. Recently, she asks for a loan for farmers like her to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe has been into hog raising for a long time. This business activity of hers enables her to support the needs of her family. She successfully repaid her financial obligations from Paglaum MPC where she first accessed her capital. She managed to maintain her membership and recently, she availed a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy piglets. Fe is looking forward to success in hog raising so that she can continuously provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Kadogo

texts.en:
Kadogo is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a farm where she grows bananas, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are seasonal changes.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop pests and diseases. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita needs to repair her house. She hopes to live comfortably with her family. She asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy plywood and nails, and to pay labor costs to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy plywood and nails, and to pay labor costs for house repair.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread,eggs, cooking oil, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful . This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is involved in farming mainly growing cocoa for selling and running motorcycle transport business locally known as bodaboda, which adds him more income. He is faced with challenges of low returns from sale of cocoa to middle men and defaulters that hinder progress of his business. However, he has a vision of increasing his family income to become a prominent cocoa trader in the area. He is married and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda with his three children and works hard to see all of them well educated. Joseph has asked for a loan to buy cocoa for selling to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, de 30 años de edad, estudio en la universitaria, está soltera, vive junto a sus padres y un hermano, de los ingresos que genera de su trabajo apoya a sus padres económicamente. 

Ana, es empleada en el ministerio de salud y tiene el cargo de auxiliar de enfermería desde hace 5 años, pero también está pensando en innovar y dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza femenina y comerciarlo con sus mismas compañeras de trabajo, la distancia que recorre hacia su trabajo es de 20 kilómetro por lo que el recorrido lo realiza a en autobús y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de revista, lociones, cremas y maquillaje, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y tener dos fuentes de ingresos.

Ana, sueña con mantener su negocio y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Ana, age 30, attended the university. She is single, and she lives with her parents and a brother. She financially supports her parents with the income she generates from her work. Ana is employed by the health ministry, and she has been a nursing assistant for five years. She is also planning on innovating and selling women's beauty products to her work colleagues. She travels 20 kilometers to get to her work. Therefore, she goes by bus. Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m until 4:00 p.m.

Ana needs the loan to buy catalog products, lotions, creams, and make-up. This loan will help her to improve her earnings and to have two sources of income. Ana dreams of maintaining her own business and that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy catalog products, lotions, creams, and make-up.

loans.name: Papuu

texts.en:
Papuu is 51 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and three daughters, her husband has been doing scrap recycling business.
Papuu's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it but due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy the scrape in bulk therefore Papuu has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that her husband can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn profitable income derived from his business.
Papuu is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan on this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her husband's scrap recycling business.

loans.name: Ziyarat

texts.en:
Ziyarat is 32 year old refugee. He is married and has 3 kids. The family lives in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates their kids. Ziyarat has been raising fruit trees (quince and persimmon) and selling them at local bazaar for 3 years. His monthly salary is 150AZN.
Quince and persimmon are very popular fruits in Azerbaijan. They are very tasty and useful for health. People use them to make pies, or jams for tea. They also use dried quince and persimmon. This is very useful when people get ill.

The assortment of fruit trees isn’t wide and this makes Ziyarat’s income very low. It’s impossible for young family to cover life demands. He wants to provide his kids with an excellent education and bright future. He does everything that he can to reach this aim. He applied for 1200AZN in order to supply fertilizers and other sorts of fruits. Expansion of tree assortment will increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to supply fertilizers and other sorts of fruits.

loans.name: Ashoki B Group

texts.en:
Joseph who is in his early 40's is a married with two kids,who are still in school. He has been selling shoes for seven years now and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Joseph's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on his shoe stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees,loan repayments, bought a plot, built a house and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase business by buying up to date shoes to meet his customers needs and requests. He dreams of opening another branch for selling up to date clothes.
Joseph will share this loan with his loan group Ashoki which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increasing on business by buying up to date shoes to meet his customers needs and request

loans.name: Ainea

texts.en: Ainea is requesting for a loan to purchase spare parts to sell to his customers. He is involved in motorcycle repair and running a retail shop selling spare parts and lubricants to motorcycle riders in town. He is faced with challenges of increasing local taxes and transport costs that hinder progress of his business. However, he operates on a busy high way and has a vision of expanding his shop and realize more income and profits in future. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ingri Del Carmen

texts.es: Ingri se encuentra dedicada a las ventas mediante guías especializadas de productos por catálogos a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; inició esta actividad con la finalidad de generar ingresos para el hogar y consideró que con su base de clientes podría tener éxito en esta actividad.  Ella se vinculó en esta forma masiva de comercialización de productos de belleza, labor en la que lleva años promoviendo ventas entre sus conocidos y amigos en diferentes barrios del municipio de Arjona.  Sus ventas son estimuladas a través del catálogo que lleva a las viviendas de sus clientes y el resto de su tiempo lo puede dedicar a sus hijos y a las tareas en el hogar.  Ella ha mantenido un excelente comportamiento comercial y desea ampliar su mercado para poder generar más ingresos, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en perfumes, cremas corporales y demás.  Esta inversión promete incrementar las ventas y el número de clientes que actualmente atiende, lo que la acerca a su meta a futuro de comprar de una vitrina y tener un local.
texts.en:
Ingri is dedicated to selling through specialized guides to catalog products, by means of which she promotes the articles on sale. She initiated this activity for the purpose of generating income for the home and believes that with her present customer base, she can experience success in this activity.

Ingri has bonded with this mass form of commercialization of beauty products, through which she has invested years promoting sales among people she knows and friends in different barrios of Arjona municipality. Her sales are stimulated by means of the catalogs she carries with her to customers' homes. Ingri dedicates the rest of her time to the children and to household tasks.

Ingri has maintained excellent commercial comportment and desires to expand her market in order to generate more income. She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in perfumes, body lotions, and other items. This investment promises to increase sales and the number of customers she actually tends to, which will draw her closer to her future goal, purchasing a glass show case and having her own shop.

loans.use: invest in perfumes,skin creams, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
A 19-year-old single man who resides in Takeo province, Sros is a university student who has passed to go to internship abroad for nine months. He is going to receive 10USD per day through this internship.

Due to having not enough funds, he is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to spend on preparing some important document such as his passport, visas and other needed materials to make his internship more convenience. He hopes to gain more experiences and improve skill to pave the way for him to get a good job.

loans.use: to spend on preparing some important documents such as passport, visas and other needed materials to support his internship, so as to improve his skills.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread,flour,cooking fat and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

He will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking fat and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is a businesswoman and a pensioner who earns through retailing of various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 52 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past twenty years, Lilia has been a farmer. She earns 6,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Lilia is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man and has 2 children. He describes himself to be good. He operates a retail business where he sells plastic bags. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic bags. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic bags

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 40 years old and she lives with her big and nice family in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. Anush has vocational medical education and many years she worked at the city hospital as a nurse. Anush is married; her husband is a driver. They have two sons and a beautiful daughter. Anush now is engaged in farming and agricultural works and as she mentions that there was a time that she managed all the work about their farm alone and perfectly but lately she feels unhealthy and weak.

She asks this Kiva loan as she must pass course of treatment and she will be very happy if lenders help her to pay for it.

loans.use: to pass course of treatment and she will be very happy if lenders help her to pay for it

loans.name: Vicross School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Milly. She is an administrator at Vicross Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Busega in Kampala with 200 students. Vicross School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Vicross School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Milly ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: María tiene 50 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 8 años de edad a la que con mucho esfuerzo está sacando adelante en sus estudios ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se preocupa por llevar el sustento al hogar y gracia a su compañero de vida le ayuda para los gastos del hogar. María se dedica a la elaboración de cepillos para lavar desde hace 6 años ya que es su mayor fuente de ingresos y es como mantiene la economía del hogar. María desea comprar materia prima para seguir en la elaboración de cepillos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, nylon rollo de colores, alambre, martillo, tijeras grampas lo mas antes posible para no dejar de trabajar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and lives in a house on her property with her life partner and her little daughter who is 8 years old. Her daughter puts a lot of effort into her studies and is doing well. Maria is a hard worker and she concerns herself with taking care of the household, and thanks to her partner who helps her with household costs. 

Maria has been making a living making washing brushes for the past 6 years since it is her main source of income and is how she maintains the home economy. 

Maria wants to purchase raw material to continue making brushes, and this is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: wood, rolls of colored nylon, wire, hammer, scissors, clamps as soon as possible to not stop working in her business.

loans.use: to invest in: wood, rolls of colored nylon, wire, hammer, scissors, clamps as soon as possible to not stop working in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in potatoes, oil, mustard, mayonnaise, cheese, cabbage, lettuce, meat, bread and all the ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter de 40 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora que en busca de sacar adelante a sus hijos decidió instalar un negocio en el cual vende frutas preparadas con sal y chile, así también vende comida típica como lo son la yuca tostada y los platanitos tostados, entre otros. Walter vive felizmente al lado de sus hijos una hija de 9 años y un hijo de 2 años de edad los cuales son la motivación de Walter para buscar la manera de salir adelante, ya que Walter es padre soltero y tiene que velar por sus dos hijos a quienes ama mucho. Es por ello que Walter solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, cemento, arena y grava para reparación de techo y suelo del negocio. De esta manera brindar un mejor ambiente para los clientes.
texts.en: 40 year Walter is a very hardworking man. In order to support his children, he decided to install a business where he sells fruits prepared with salt and chili. He also sells typical food such as toasted cassava and toasted plantains, among other things. Walter lives happily with his children: a 9 year old daughter and a 2 year old son, who are his motivation to look for ways to prosper, because Walter is a single father and needs to take care of his children whom he loves a lot. This is why Walter is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: metal sheets, poles, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof and the floor of his store. This way he can give a better environment to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, poles, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof and the floor of his store.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, soap, bread, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread,milk, flour and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en: Samreen is 34, mother of four children lives in the area of Multan,Pakistan.She needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purposes, therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop

loans.name: Bulmaro

texts.en:
Bulmaro is a Mexican farmer who owns a cow, hogs, and cultivates corn and kidney beans on a field close to his house. He used to spend an large proportion of his revenue in the purchase of expensive and unsustainable LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizer. By investing in a biodigester, he will be able to transform his animals' manure into biogas connected to a cookstove and boiler in his house, as well as into organic fertilizer for his field. He will become his own supplier of renewable energy and fertilizer, reducing his operating expenses and increasing the yield of his field in a natural way.

As he treats the manure instead of piling it up in his farm, flies, bad smells and potential sources of infection will disappear, turning his farm into a cleaner, more comfortable living and working environment.

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to acquire a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Boram

texts.en:
A single man whose name is Boram, 20, is a university student living in Phnom Penh city. Recently, Boram works as an intern to get a salary for supporting his studying and improve his skills as well. He has been involved with this work for many months.

For Boram, this is his first loan cycle with VisionFund and he will use his entire loan to spend on preparing some necessary documents for his nine-month vocational training abroad such as passport, visas and necessary items. He hopes to get a good knowledge from this vocational training.

loans.use: to spend on preparing some necessary documents such as passport, visas and other necessary study materials for a study trip abroad.

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es: Luz de 22 años de edad vive al lado de su familia, la cual está conformada por su madre y dos hermanos. Luz es una persona muy trabajadora quien, en busca de poder ayudar en la economía del hogar y así poder cambiar la calidad de vida de su familia, ha instalado un negocio de venta de bebidas en una institución educativa. Entre las bebidas que vende están, licuados de diferentes frutas, refrescos y bebidas gaseosas. Debido a que este negocio lo tiene instalado en una institución educativa la demanda es bastante grande por estas bebidas, y es por lo que Luz solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: guineos, naranjas, fresas, papayas, leche, jugos, bebidas gaseosas y así también más licuadoras para su negocio, para poder ofrecer una mayor eficiencia en la atención a los clientes y de esta forma aumentar las ventas.
texts.en: Luz is 22 years old and she lives with her family, made up of her mother and two sisters. Luz is a very hardworking person who, in search of a way to help with the family finances and thus change her family's quality of life, has started a business selling beverages at an educational institution. Among the beverages she sells are different fruit smoothies, juices and sodas. Because her business is in an educational institution, demand is high for these beverages. That is why Luz is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in bananas, oranges, strawberries, papayas, milk, juices, sodas and also more blenders for her business. this way, she can offer better efficiency while serving customers, and that way she can increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to invest in bananas, oranges, strawberries, papayas, milk, juices, sodas and blenders for her business.

loans.name: Patricia Magdalena

texts.es: Patricia de 30 años de edad vive al lado de sus padres, Patricia en busca de ayudar a sus padres, presta sus servicios domésticos en un cafetín dentro de un centro educativo, labor que le permite aportar a la economía del hogar, pues su sueño es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y para pagar mano de obra, para la elaboración de un muro de contención y un cuarto habitación. En cuanto a la mano de obra, nada más se pagará a un ayudante, ya que el padre de Patricia desempeña la labor de albañil independiente y así de esta forma también el padre aporta su ayuda para las necesidades básicas del hogar.
texts.en: Patricia is 30 years old and lives with her parents. In order to help them, Patricia works in domestic chores at a small cafe inside an educational center. This job allows her to help with the household finances, because her dream is to be able to improve the quality of life of her family. For this reason she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay for hand labor to build a retaining wall and a bedroom. Regarding hand labor, they will only pay for an assistant, because Patricia's father works as an independent mason, and in this way he gives his support with the household's basic needs.

loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay for hand labor to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariela es una mujer de 50 años de edad, residente de un barrio ubicado en Arjona un municipio de Bolívar. Esta mujer desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece servicios de estética, ella siempre le gustó todo lo relacionado con los tratamientos para el cuidado del cabello y las uñas, así que se capacito en una academia y  empezó a ofrecer en el año 1990 los servicios de manicure, pedicure, blower, cortes de cabello para damas, tinturaciones y masajes capilares.  La gran mayoría de sus servicios se generan a domicilio y en su vivienda adecuó un espacio donde realiza sus trabajos, aunque su horario bastante extenso, su compromiso con el trabajo y sus deseos de cumplir sus propósitos y metas la fortalecen y la motivan a continuar el ritmo laboral.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en productos de belleza como shampoo, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes y removedores, y renovará sus herramientas de trabajo como su secador y nuevos cepillos. Esta inversión hace más eficiente su labor y ofrecería servicios de mejor calidad.  Mariela está casada y es madre de dos hijos y con su trabajo ha ofrecido una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariela is a 50-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood located in Arjona, a municipality in Bolívar. This woman offers beauty services from the comfort of her home. She has always liked everything related to hair and nail treatments. For that reason, she enrolled in a beauty academy and began to offer manicure, pedicure, blower, women's haircut, dyes, and scalp massages in 1990. The great majority of her services are carried out in her home where she has a work space. Although her schedule is long, Mariela's dedication to her work and her desire to achieve her goals strengthens her and motivates her to keep up her working rhythm.

Currently, Mariela is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest this loan in beauty products such as shampoo, scalp treatments, nail polishes and removers, as well as update her work tools such as her hair dryer and new brushes. This investment will make her work more efficient so she will offer better quality services.

Mariela is married and has two children. With her work, she has offered them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in beauty products such as shampoo, scalp treatments, nail polishes and removers, as well as update her work tools such as her hair dryer and new brushes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shirts, blouses, pants, spandex, dresses, a variety of jewelry, etc., to improve the selection of products in her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 55 years old, is married and a resident of Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold in the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market.

On May 14, 2007, both Susana and her husband agreed to join PMPC to avail a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

She has now applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. With PMPC’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela manages her eatery business in Pagadian City. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. It has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio, de 49 años de edad, nunca asistió a la escuela, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica al comercio de verduras y productos para la cocina, tienen 3 hijos y ellos dependen de él.

Dionicio, se dedica al transporte, tiene un vehículo en el que realiza viajes, es muy conocido en la zona porque tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad de generar ingresos al hogar la llevo tomar la iniciativa de dedicarse al transporte, antes de dedicarse al transporte trabajaba la agricultura, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.  

Dionicio, necesita el préstamo para pagar la reparación del vehículo con el que trabaja; la necesidad será satisfecha y podrá seguir generando ingresos para su familia.     

Dionicio, sueña con ver a sus hijos estudiando y poder reparar su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 49 years old and never attended school. He is in a common-law relationship and his partner works selling vegetables and kitchen supplies. They have 3 children who are dependant on him.
Dionicio works in transportation. He has a vehicle that he uses to make trips and is very well known in his area because he has been doing this work for 10 years.
The need to generate income for the home gave him the initiative to work in transportation. Prior to working in transportation he worked in agriculture. His work schedule is 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Dionicio needs the loan to pay for repairs to his vehicle that he uses for work. This need will be satisfied with the loan and he will be able to continue generating an income for his family.
Dionicio dreams of seeing his children studying and being able to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his vehicle that he uses for work.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Rosebella is in her early 30s, single with four children. Three of them are in school and one is still small. She has been a tailor for fifteen years now. She works from 10am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy nice materials and make up to date suits and dresses to sale. She dreams of owning more sewing machines.

Rosebella will share this loan with her loan group Ulezi which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy nice materials and make up to date suits and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a merchant residing in the town of Carmen, Bohol. She is a vendor who sells fruits like bananas, papaya, and vegetables like beans, and upo (bottle gourd).
She is 49 year old, married with a 17-year old dependent. Her husband has an income that could help the family's daily expenses.

She needs additional funds to finance her current source of income. Leonora has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy variety of fruits and vegetables. With these, it could enhanced more display of fruits and vegetables that could cause to attract buyers to come.
With these, she could able to set aside some savings for emergency use.

In the future, Leonora is determined that she could be able to continue finance the schooling of her child and continue manage to be come successful.

loans.use: to buy  variety of  fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en: Mitchelle signed up for membership in PMPC to access its financial services. She runs a hog-raising business that earns her a quarterly income of PHP 17,000, which gives her the opportunity to help her husband in providing for the family's needs. She's doing well in her business and manages her accounts with the cooperatives. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is an active member of PMPC who enjoys all the perks of being a member. She is a 74-year-old widow with adult children. Marciana is busy running her fishing operations and tilling her own land. Both business ventures have been supported by PMPC. She said she's secure financially knowing she can always turn to the cooperative, but she wants to be prepared also for unprecedented life events, so she also buys life insurance from PMPC. Now that her one-year life insurance has expired, she is borrowing an amount to pay for the life insurance renewal of the family. Marciana believes that it is better to be prepared for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for the life insurance renewal of the family.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, cabbages, potatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cabbages, onions, tomatoes and other vegetables. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbages, onions, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single woman and has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a restaurant within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 52 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su padre, hermano y su hijo de 18 años de edad. El se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado y es con su pequeño negocio que el va saliendo adelante para mantener la economia de su hogar.
