Roberto anteriormente obtuvo un crédito para obtener mayores ingresos ya que este negocio es su principal fuente de apoyo y como le funciono muy bien el solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: nueva mercaderia de ropa, accesorios y sandalias para dama y de esta forma tener mayor variedad para su clientela.
texts.en:
Roberto is 52 years old and lives in his own home, with his father, brother and his 18 year old son.
He works selling clothing and shoes and it is with this small business that he is providing for the maintenance of his home.
Roberto was previously given a loan in order to improve his income. This business is his main source of support and because it functions very well he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in new merchandise of clothing, accessories and women's sandals and in this way have greater variety for his customers.

loans.use: to invest in new merchandise of clothing, accessories and women's sandals and in this way have greater variety.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earn as well for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has seek financial help to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.In the future, Arlyn wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal and she will use the anticipated profits to expand business

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her tea estate.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been in the business of selling milk from childhood; he learned all the techniques for getting milk from his forefathers. This is the only source of income for the family. One of his cattle has grown old and is producing very low quantities of milk. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door. For delivery purposes, he uses his bicycle. He loads milk cans on his bicycle and delivers them early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs.

Therefore, he plans to purchase one more buffalo to increase his sales. However, he finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Sughram has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to increase sales, but it will also increase his net income and savings as well. They hope to provide a quality education for their children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a buffalo for his milk-selling business.

loans.name: Mufeedan

texts.en:
Mufeedan is a simple house wife, with one child, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own business as a wheat wholesaler for the past 20 years.
He needs to buy wheat bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling purpose, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these commodities.

Therefore Mufeedan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling purpose to earn maximum income. His profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of family and business.
Mufeedan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in his wholesale wheat business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase on the genge and to buy chicks and chicken feeds for the poultry business.

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en: Jealyn has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Pagadian City and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Jealyn knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Jealyn hopes to buy hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda finds pleasure in her gardening activities. Gardening is not only her hobby, it's also how she earns an income. Glenda is 40 years old and married. She keeps busy to provide sufficiently for her family.

Glenda seized the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with providing her the capital to support her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Glenda wishes to become the flower supplier for the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 42-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and a mother of two children ages 15 and nine years old. Her husband works hard as farmer while Rosalina is engaged in selling food. She has been doing this for two years to earn a living. She is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil and spices. Rosalina is determined to have other business opportunities to help them enhance their livelihood. She is thinking of raising pigs in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be cooperative. She operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a trading centre and the business is doing well and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a restaurant within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, the business will improve and create employment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Elinah

texts.en:
Elinah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be polite.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat, toothpaste, and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, and other items.

Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a greater variety of basic products to stock her store and generate greater economic income.

loans.name: Ruth Nohemy

texts.es: Ruth de 25 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ruth con el fin de darle todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo ha instalado un pequeño negocio en su comunidad en el cual vende artículos de consumo diario. Su esposo le ayuda con la economía del hogar gracias a su empleo de seguridad, de esta manera buscan la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo. Para ello Ruth solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: café, azúcar, arroz, salsas, bebidas gaseosas, aceites, entre otros artículos para el hogar y así poder mantener el negocio y ofrecer más productos para obtener una mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Ruth, 25 years old, lives with her partner in life and their six year old son. To provide everything necessary for her small child, Ruth has started a small business in their community, selling items of daily use. Her husband helps her support their home financially through his job as a security guard. In this way they look to improve their quality of life and that of their son.

Ruth is asking for a loan from FUSAI to spend on coffee,sugar, rice, sauces, soft drinks, oils and other household items for resale. In this way she will be able to continue her business and offer more products to get better earnings.

loans.use: to buy coffee,sugar, rice, sauces, soft drinks, oils and other household items.

loans.name: Karimi

texts.en:
Karimi is a married woman. She has seven children. She operates a farm. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Muthakye

texts.en:
Muthakye is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will sell more variety of clothes. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Irvin Jhontatan

texts.en:
Irvin is a 25 year old single man and he still lives at his parents' house, but he contributes to the house income with part of his wages. He earns his wages by working for a car agency on the logistics area. He paid a part of his college tuition, the other part was covered by his parents.

Irvin has been studying international commerce. He is almost finished as he is only missing a few subjects, a few exams and the final tuition.

Although this is the first credit at Kubo and Kiva, Kubo is confident that he will repay because of a good credit history.

loans.use: pay his final year tuition fees in International Commerce and graduate .

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en:
Asifa is 27 years old and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in a shopping bag making business to earn an income. She started her factory 8 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Asifa wants to buy raw material for her shopping bag making business to earn a proper income but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to buy raw material for her business. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her shopping bags directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in her shopping bag making business. So Asifa demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Asifa will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shopping bag making business.

loans.name: Airez

texts.en:
Airez is a 27-year-old married woman and she lives in Magsaysay,Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines to earn a living together with her three children. Over the past five years, Airez was able to manage her banana plantation that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm was still doing well and was giving enough money to cover their daily expenses.

With her generated revenue, she was able to save money. Recently, she took a loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer to improve her farm. Airez expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer to improve her farm

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en: Tarek is 29, single and has a small cleansers sales business that he started to help his mother with the family income. He is requesting 3000 EGP loan to buy more cleansers to increase his sales for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cleansers for sale.

loans.name: Ellien

texts.en:
Ellien is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 school-aged kids from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She has run and operated a hog raising business for the past 7 years. In the year 2000, Ellien signed up for PMPC membership to access its financial services. Her business did well and she managed to save most of her profits. She expanded her hog raising business by adding heads of piglets.

Glenda is in need of additional working capital to purchase 10 bags of animal feed, so she is requesting a loan from the cooperative. She hopes to maintain her membership with PMPC because they have always helped her with her financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Agusto

texts.en:
Agusto is a 54-year-old married father of six children. He is a teacher and his wife is a housewife. Agusto who works hard to support his family. 

Although the family works very hard, it is not enough to support the cost of their daughter's education. This loan of 1,000 USD will allow Agusto to help his daughter register for university. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies. 

In the future, Agusto hopes that his children will all be well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for university registration, textbooks and school supplies for his daughter.

loans.name: Layal Group

texts.en:
Tala is the featured borrower of Layal Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. The Group  have always been best friends and they work hard to develop their living.

Tala is a 22-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor since 2009. She works from her parents' house to cover her education expenses and living needs. But her income is barely enough to cover any additional requests. Thus, her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, will be invested in paying for her Early Child Education course fees.

Tala is the second lady from the right. As for the other group members, Hassana is the first from the right, Layal is the second from the left, while Majida is the first lady at the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her Early Child Education course fees.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a Kiva borrower. He has one child and describes himself to be reliable. Eric operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, bread, soap, soft drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for eight years. 

Eric's business is located in an area where demand for products is high and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use this 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a cereals store within five years. 

This is Eric's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Noni

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Noni, who is a 35-year-old married woman. 

Noni has been selling and crediting electronics with her husband, an employee, for the past three years. She has asked for a loan of 7,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home, which will improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.  

Noni's family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but she will be able to repay the loan received. Noni and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.en:
Domingos is a 31-year-old married father of one child who works hard to support his family. He is a Medical Doctor and his wife is also a Medical Doctor. 

Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to support the cost of their brother’s education. This loan of 1,000 USD will allow Domingos to help his brother to study at university, because his brother is far from them. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies for his brother. 

Domingos loves his brother very much and hopes that further education will help him to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies for his brother.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
For the last 5 years, Illuminda has raised and sold hogs. These serve as her main source of income. She is a forty-one year old married woman with 4 dependents. Her oldest is 22 while the youngest is 11. She hails from the the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to purchase pigs and feeds. These resources are very essential to sustain her livelihood going down the road towards progress. In a few months to come, she will be able to sell quality hogs and augment her income. She could continue to provide the needs of her children and provide nutritious meals.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 28-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has three children ages eight, six and three years old. She sells (rice cake known as) “bibingka”, “bodbod” (slightly sweet sticky rice with coconut milk wrapped in banana leaves) and “moron” (is a milk and chocolate twisted flavored sticky rice cake wrapped in banana leaves)  for five years to earn a living, while her husband works hard as a farmer to provide the needs of their family. She is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, coconut milk and sugar for her food selling business. In the future, she wishes to own a sari-sari store to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy rice, coconut milk and sugar

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a tailoring business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open other outlets within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Sedekia

texts.en: Sedekia is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy carpentry materials. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body for a long time. He is unable to attract passengers and generate income due to the rickshaw body's ugly appearance. He wants to buy a new body as soon as possible, but due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost.

Therefore, Rabia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband with the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to replace her husband's old rickshaw body for his transportation services.

loans.name: Leosan

texts.en:
Leosan is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leosan is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leosan has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leosan requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, flour, sugar, oil, etc..

Leosan has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Leosan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolores is 53 years old now.

Dolores has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, vegetable, etc..

Dolores has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: tobuy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 29-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Sobia has been running her own beauty salon for the past 10 years; she also contributes her income to help manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty saloon; but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Sobia has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Sobia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Valeriia

texts.en:
Valeriia chose to study at AUCA believing that it offers the best education in liberal arts and sciences available in Central Asia. The AUCA classes will allow her not just to learn about the role of history in American, Soviet, and Central Asian societies, but also will teach her economic, political, sociocultural, and environmental issues that surround us every day. She is very interested in exchange programs, provided by AUCA. She hopes to be selected to an exchange program, which will give her the chance to be abroad.

For Valeriia AUCA is not only about readings and doing homework, but also student-run TV, “New Star” newspaper, and other student-led initiatives like annually university-wide events, fundraising, etc. Valeriia considers all these things as the essential stuff for students as they allow developing and growing personally. Finally being a part of such amazing student life will positively influence on her both academic and personal growth.

Discussing family, Valeriia lives with her grandparents, who are retired. Her parents left to Russia 6 years ago to make a living and stayed there. From that day they totally support Valeriia and her grandparents in Kyrgyzstan. Valeriia says that her family had sacrificed the enjoyment of family get-togethers, shared laughs and movie evenings for the sake of having relatively stable financial situation. However, her parents’ salary is not enough to cover the tuition fee at AUCA. Valeriia was happy to find out about Kiva loans for AUCA students and thanks Kiva for opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA

loans.name: Ela Dina

texts.es: Ela de 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y una hija de 26 años de edad, su esposo le ayuda en la economía del hogar gracias a su empleo de seguridad. Ela se dedica a la venta de joyería y venta de comida típica como yuca, pasteles, papas fritas y varios, con lo cual se ayuda económicamente. Es por ello que Ela solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en: anillos, pulseras, aretes y todo tipo de joyería y así también en repollo, tomates, papas, mayonesa, salsa dulce entre muchas cosas más que necesita para vender variedad de comida, y así poder obtener más ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ela, 54 years old, lives in a house of her own with her husband and a 26-year-old daughter. Her husband helps her in the household finances thanks to his job in security. Ela makes a living selling jewelry and selling traditional food such as cassava, meat and vegetable pastries, chips, and several others with which she helps herself financially. That is why Ela is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in rings, bracelets, earrings, and all kinds of jewelry as well as in cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, mayonnaise, and sweet sauce among many more things that she needs to sell a variety of food and therefore be able to obtain more profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in rings, bracelets, earrings, and all kinds of jewelry as well as in cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, mayonnaise, and sweet sauce, among others, to make food.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as optimistic. For the past 2 years, she has operated a retail business where she sells charcoal. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her professional goal is to have a well-established business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He operates a farm where he grows tea, and he has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tea for resale. His business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al comercio de medicina natural, tienen una hija la cual vive con ellos, en su casa vive la suegra y la cuñada de él, pero solo la esposa y la hija dependen de él.

Daniel, trabaja en una carpintería desde hace más de tres años y el trabajo lo realiza con su suegro, quien es el que le ha enseñado todo lo que sabe de la carpintería y con el paso de los años ha decidido continuar con este trabajo, porque en la zona es muy rentable.

Daniel, necesita el préstamo para pagar la reparación de una cierra de mesa y para comprar madera, ya que con esto podrá completar a tiempo dos pedidos que tiene de parte de la iglesia de la ciudad.

Los sueños de Daniel son, ver crecer la carpintería para seguir trabajando y poder darle a su hija el estudio necesario y que en el futuro pueda estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Daniel has been working in a carpentry shop for more than three years. He works with his brother-in-law, who has taught him all he knows about carpentry. With the passage of years, Daniel has decided to continue with this work, because it's very profitable in the area.

Daniel needs a loan to pay for repairing a table saw and to buy wood since that will make it possible for him to fill in a timely way two orders he has received from the church of his city.

Daniel's dreams are to see the carpentry shop grow so he can continue working and to be able to give his son the chance to go to school, and in the future to get a college education.

loans.use: to pay for repairing a table saw and to buy wood.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, rice, and other items and she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Esmeralda Marisol

texts.es: Esmeralda de 33 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, también de sus dos hijas de 14 y 16 años de edad. Esmeralda se dedica a la venta de comida típica como lo son la yuca frita, papas fritas y tortas. Negocio con el cual busca la manera de obtener ingresos para la economía del hogar, así también su esposo ayuda económicamente en el hogar ya que se dedica a la labor de albañil independiente. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, Esmeralda, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papas, yuca, aceite, mayonesa, queso, repollo, lechuga, palillos, platos desechables, y demás productos necesarios para su negocio y también reparará su carro de ventas.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 33 years old. She lives alongside her life partner, as well as her two daughters, 14 and 16. Esmeralda works selling traditional dishes such as fried yuca, fries, and sandwiches. With her business, she seeks a way to obtain more income for her household expenses. In addition, her husband helps financially to the home, as he works independently in construction. 

In search of a better quality of life for her and her family, Esmeralda is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: potatoes, yuca (cassava), cooking oil, mayonnaise, cheese, cabbage, lettuce, seasoning, paper plates, and other necessary products for her business. In addition, she will repair her food cart.

loans.use: To invest in: potatoes, yuca (cassava), cooking oil, mayonnaise, cheese, cabbage, lettuce, seasoning, paper plates, and other necessary products for her business.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell in her kiosk such as cigarettes, eggs, coffee, toothpaste, glue, hair oils, candies, sugar, detergent, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other items. Domingas opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy about the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin as it will provide more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, eggs, coffee, toothpaste, glue, hair oils, candies, sugar, detergent, soft drinks, and hard drinks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and she has been in business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She also involved in farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as caring. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a single woman with 1 child. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat, toothpaste, vegetables, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, and other items.

loans.name: Wilinton

texts.es: Wilinton es un tendero de Arjona un municipio ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar y que gracias a su experiencia obtenida en anteriores empleos, emprendió su propio negocio.  Todos los días de la semana apertura su tienda desde temprano y sus clientes pueden llevar a sus hogares los productos de la canasta familiar entre ellos frutas, carnes, legumbres, aceite, azúcar entre otros.  Wilinton tiene metas para su negocio muy prometedoras para su futuro, entre ellas adquirir su propio local y en el brindar servicio de panadería y miscelánea, sin embargo considera que la única forma de lograr esta meta es realizando acciones que le permitan hacerlas realidad, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en un mayor surtido de víveres y lograr que sus inventarios correspondan a las necesidades de los clientes e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Wilinton is a shopkeeper in Arjona, a city located in the department of Bolívar. Relying on his experience in previous jobs, he started his own business. Every day of the week his store is open early and his customers can take home basic household foods such as fruit, meat, vegetables, oil and sugar. Wilinton has very promising future goals for his business, among them to buy his own place and provide bakery and general store services.

The only way he sees to achieve this goal, taking action to make his dreams reality,
is by applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Wilinton will invest the loan in a larger selection of food supplies and succeed in making his inventory match the needs of his customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to invest in a larger selection of food supplies.

loans.name: John Rey

texts.en: John Rey is a public school teacher and is also an active member of Paglaum MPC. He is 25 years old, married and has a parcel of land where he grows rice, which he has operated for almost three years. Recently John Rey availed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area her her products are in high demand and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. 

Rose will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. Her business goal is to have a fruits processing firm within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit.

loans.name: Jose Orlando Osmar

texts.es:
José, de 50 años de edad, nunca asistió a una escuela, cuando el creció no habían escuelas a las que pudiera asistir y esto lo limito la posibilidad de aprender a leer y a escribir; pero fue en un curso de alfabetización de parte de la alcaldía donde aprendió.- Está casado, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de aves de corral y también cría cerdos, junto a ella tiene 4 hijos, pero solo uno vive con ellos.  

José, se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura, cría ganado, ordeña 5 vacas, de las cuales procesa la leche y la convierte en queso y luego lo comercializa con los vecinos; pero también trabaja fuerte la agricultura y con esto sustenta la alimentación de la familia y también el ganado en tiempo de verano, toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad y fue su padre quien le enseño todo lo relacionado al cuido del ganado y el trabajo de la agricultura.- También tiene un camión en el que realiza viajes cuando lo buscan, todos los domingos sale a traer gente de un cantón para llevarlos al pueblo.  

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar maicillo y pagar personas para que le ayuden a sembrar que le ayuden a realizar el trabajo. 

Su sueño es darle siempre lo necesario a su esposa y poder mantener todo lo que tiene para que en su momento le pueda heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 50 years old, never went to school. When he was growing up, there was no school he could attend, and this limited his chances to learn to read and write. However in a literacy course given by the municipality, Jose learned to read. He is married, and his wife works taking care of poultry and raising pigs. Jose and his wife have four children, but only one son lives with them.

Jose works at raising cattle and farming. He raises cattle and milks five cows, processing the milk and turning it into cheese, which he then sells to neighbors. However, he also works hard at farming, and thus provides food for his family and, in the summer time, to the cattle. He has earned a living in this way all his life. It was his father who taught Jose everything relative to caring for cattle and the work of farming. Jose also has a truck and will take people places for pay when they seek him out. Every Sunday he goes out to bring people from one area to town.

Jose needs the loan to buy materials for planting sorghum and paying people to help him plant his crop.His dream is to always be able to provide everything necessary for his wife and maintain all that he owns in order to some day leave it to his children.

loans.use: to buy materials for sowing sorghum and pay people to help him plant his crop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hard-working mother from the town of Sagbayan, Bohol. She earns a livelihood by raising pigs. She is a 56-year-old widowed woman with four grown children. She would like to augment her earnings and to have a stable income.

A loan of 7,000 PHP was requested  by Rosita to buy piglets and feed. These are vital in producing quality pigs. Thus, slowly her income will increase and she can afford to buy nutritious meals, which is essential in her day-to-day living. In this way, Rosita can start to settle her obligations and invest  any possible opportunities for improving her livelihood. 

Rosita is doing her very best to become more sustainable and productive in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has three loving children, one in high school and the other two are on the elementary level. She’s managing a food vending business where she sell snacks and dressed chicken. She works hard to help her husband, Resty, who’s working as an OFW. It’s not easy for Erlinda to raise their children alone that’s why she want to make the business grow, as she wants her husband to stay in the Philippines with them and help her manage the business.  

Erlinda knows that they can survive on a daily basis as God is their greatest provider. Though in a business, there are challenges that can’t be avoided like the delay of payments from customers, which affects the business’ revenue. She prays that she’ll have a revolving fund that she can use for the business and added capital to buy necessities for her buy-and-sell business like processed foods, snacks, pork, and chicken. That’s why she applied for a loan amount of PHP 11,000. She wants to have her own place to run the business so that she'll no longer have to pay for monthly rental. She knows that on God’s time it will happen. 

Erlinda believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she can gain spiritual strength from member’s life-changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay microfinance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy necessities for her business like processed foods, snacks, pork, and chicken.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en: Keziah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Farah will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Alegrijes Group

texts.es:
Maria es une mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘güapurú’ caracterizado por acoger a los sobrevivientes del desborde del río años atrás. 
Maria es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico mediano (de pie al centro, viste polera amarilla). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte junto a su hijo que aún no está en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de comida, como; ‘majao’ que es una comida tradicional a base de yuca y charque (carne deshidratada), “en la región el arroz no se granea se prepara con manteca y sin condimentos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a diario, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar muebles de comedor. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles para su puesto de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 23-year-old single woman who has one 5-year-old child. Her business is selling food.

She is proactive, a good mother and very tenacious. Her business is in the ‘güapurú’ neighbourhood, which is known for having taken in the survivors when the river burst its banks some years ago.

Maria is dark and short, with a medium stature (standing in the center, she is wearing a yellow shirt). Her first language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her son, who is not yet old enough to go to school. They live in a rented room that has all the basic amenities.

In this loan cycle, she will lead the entrepreneur's bank.

Her business is selling food, such as ‘majao’, a traditional dish made from yucca and 'charque' (dried meat), “in this region we don't cook fluffy rice, we cook it with lard and without condiments", she says. The advantage of her business is that she has sales every day. The disadvantage is that there is no money to buy restaurant furniture. Her dream is to have a stable business. She wants to buy tables and chairs for her stand.

This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been running this business. It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to buy furniture for her food stand.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her food stand.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread, salt and other items. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, bread, milk and other items. His business goal is to have a mini supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, bread, milk and other items.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells groundnuts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient business space. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to rent a premises for the business. 

Teresia's business goal is to have her own business premises within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to rent a premises for her business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 23 años de edad es un joven muy trabajador y honrado actualmente vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad quienes son por quienes sale a trabajar todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para llevarles el alimento diario. El actualmente se dedica a prestar sus servicios como transportista el transporta carga hacia los mercados y a personas dentro del municipio, también hace viajes exprés fuera del municipio, u donde sus clientes desean viajar para ello cuenta con un vehículo propio pero que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado es por eso que José está solicitando un crédito  FUSAI para invertirlo en la reparación de esté para mantenerlo en buenas condiciones para no tener el problema para realizar viajes cuando se lo pidan de esta manera no se quedara sin trabajo por mal estado del vehículo. El espera una respuesta positiva al crédito puesto que esto le ayudara a mantener y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
At 23 years old, José is a very hard-working and honest young man. He currently lives with his wife and his little, one-year-old daughter, and it is for them that he gets up and goes to work everyday, with a lot of effort and dedication, to provide them with daily sustenance.


At the moment he is working as a truck driver. He takes loads of things to the markets and drives people around town. He also does longer trips outside the city, or wherever his clients want to go. For this, he has his own vehicle, but it is currently in a bad state of repair.

For this reason José is requesting a FUSAI loan, to invest in repairs for his vehicle so he can keep it in good condition and not run into problems while carrying out the trips he is asked to make. In this way, he won't be unemployed for the bad shape of his vehicle.

He is hoping for a positive response to his loan application since it will help him maintain and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in repairs for his vehicle, which is his means of making an honest living.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs to his taxi because the current condition is not good, as it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Gulshan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Gulshan's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Gulshan also plans to make savings with the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Gulshan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband make wanted repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, 48, is a married woman who has two children, one of whom is still in school. She lives with her family in Kampong Cham province where rice has been growing for 30 years. Drought, decline of the price of rice at times and pests in the field are the obstacles to the farming business.

To save her business, Chreb formed a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund for the first time. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve the rice farm.

Chreb hopes that the crop will return high yields and that she can support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve the rice farm in order to support her children’s studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sergio Samuel

texts.es:
Sergio, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no continuo sus estudios porque le tocaba viajar hacia la ciudad.- Está soltero, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos y con lo que gana de su trabajo le apoya a su madre.

Sergio, es cocinero en un restaurante y tiene más de 10 años de trabajar en el mismo lugar, entro a trabajar como encargado de limpieza, luego fue aprendiendo a cocinar y le dieron la oportunidad de ascender a cocinero. También maneja un negocio de venta de ropa, para todo tipo de persona y productos de belleza, estos productos se los vende una hermana, pero él es el dueño. El restaurante está a 1 kilómetro de distancia y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. 

El préstamo será utilizado para pagar un pedido de mercadería que ya recibió, el crédito le permitirá poder seguir negociando con sus productos y a tender a su clientela que es muy exigente. 

Sus sueños son el poder mantener su empleo y su negocio, pero también desea poder apoyar a su madre económicamente.
texts.en:
Sergio, 34 years old, studied until high school. He did not continue his studies because he had to travel to the city. He is single and lives at home with his parents together with his siblings, and with what he earns from his job he supports his mother.

Sergio is a cook in a restaurant and has worked in the same place for over 10 years. He starting working as a cleaner, and later learned to cook and they gave him the opportunity to rise and become a cook. He also runs a business selling clothing for all types of people and beauty products. One of his sisters sells these products, but he is the owner. The restaurant is 1 kilometer away and his work schedule is 6:00 am to 8:00 pm.

The loan will be used to pay for a merchandise order that he already received. The loan will allow him to be able to continue business with his products and to tend to his customers who are very demanding.

His dream is to be able to maintain his job and his business, but he also wants to be able to support his mother financially.

loans.use: to pay for a merchandise order that he already received.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself  as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells eggs and cashew nuts. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES25,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs and cashew nuts. His business goal is to have a business premises within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs and cashew nuts.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 30 years old and has five children, two of who are in school. She is married.

Melisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melisa has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Kenny Williams

texts.es:
Kenny es un joven hombre de 21 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la carpintería. 
Él es buen padre, independiente y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chasquipampa’ área residencial donde la anterior década servía de pastoreo al ganado, actualmente edificios y comercio son el centro del barrio.
Kenny es de baja estatura, físico delgado y piel morena. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. su vida la comparte con su esposa que vende dulces y con su bebe, viven en casa familiar construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la carpintería, él compra madera y fabrica puertas, closets, mesas, sillas y otros, “aprendí el oficio de mi padre, con mi familia me tuve que independizar…”  comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede generar ingresos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de herramientas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, el desea comprar herramientas, como; torno, sierras, lijas y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Kenny solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Kenny is a young 21-year-old man who is married and has a 2-year-old child. His business is carpentry.

He is a good father, independent, and very hardworking. He carries out his business in the 'chasquipampa' zone, a residential area where the previous decade it was a pasture land for cattle and currently buildings and businesses are the center of the neighborhood.

Kenny is of short stature, thin, and has dark skin. His mother tongue is Aymará and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his wife, who sells sweets, and with his baby. They live in a home made of brick that has all basic services. His business is carpentry. He buys wood and makes doors, closets, tables, chairs, and other things. "I learned the trade from my father, with my family I had to become independent..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he can generate income. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy tools.

His dream is to have his own home. He wants to buy tools such as: a drill, saws, sandpaper, and other things. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in three years that he has done this business. These are the reasons why Kenny requests a loan to buy tools for his carpenter's shop.

loans.use: to buy tools for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Fransiscar

texts.en:
Fransiscar is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows maize, kale and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to be a great supplier of vegetables within five years.

She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful in business and be able to educate her children. She will use the anticipated profits to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be reliable.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with high demand for the products, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, bread, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Hunningtone

texts.en:
Hunningtone is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital to service his motorcycle. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair the motorcycle and buy a helmet.

His business goal is to own two more motorcycles and a tuk tuk within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle and buy a helmet.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 65 years old and has 10 children. Mansueta is a widowed woman.

Mansueta is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Mansueta requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mansueta has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mansueta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Aksaar

texts.en:
Aksaar is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Aksaar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Aksaar's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Aksaar also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Aksaar is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Afi  Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans qui avec quatre enfants à charge à Tokoin. Enyonam est une revendeuse de condiments qui achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant dans les quartiers. Enyonam sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de piment et des bols d’ail afin de bien vendre et avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Enyonam is thirty-four years old, married and has four children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells food ingredients from her home and on foot in local neighbourhoods. She buys new stock once a month from the market.

Enyonam has requested this loan to buy baskets of chillies and bowls of garlic. Her increased earnings will help her husband to provide for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 7 baskets of chillies and 8 bowls of garlic.

loans.name: Walpoua

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Walpoua est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Pour exercer son activité, Walpoua vit à Tokoin et vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des bijoux en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Walpoua s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des triplets des assiettes et des colliers complets, Walpoua demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver puis bien revendreet avoir un gain pour aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Walpoua is twenty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells kitchen utensils and jewellery on foot in local neighbourhoods. She buys new stock twice a month from the market.

Walpoua has requested this loan to buy plates and necklaces. Her increased earnings will improve her children's standard of living and provide them with a good education.

loans.use: to buy plates and necklaces.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Sidi est l’homme qui est au milieu tenant dans ses mains le sac de sel.
Sidi est un commerçant âgée de 41 ans, marié, père de 04 enfants dont l’ainè à 12 ans, les 04 sont tous scolarisès, et son conjoint est une femme courageuse dans son activité qui n’est  autres choses que le petit commerce, Sidi est analphabète, il n’a pas eu une chance d’aller à l’école. Sidi est un  homme courageux et ambitieux dans son travail , n’ayant pas assez de moyen pour développer son activité de  commerce de sel. il fait recours à L’IMF pour avoir plus de fonds  pour mener d’avantage le développement de son activité pour qu’il puisse être rentable .Il s’approvisionne dans les foires de la localité et après approvisionnement il effectue la distribution de ses marchandises dans les différents foires de la localité ;il peut réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel de 70000f par mois . Le bénéfice du crédit de L’IMF lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famille tel que : la scolarisation des enfants, la sante.
texts.en:
Sidi is seen in the middle in the photo, holding a bag of salt. He is forty-one years old, married and father to four children. The eldest is twelve years old. All four of his children attend school. Sidi's wife is a courageous woman who also works as a vendor.

Sidi didn't have the opportunity to attend school so he can't read or write. He is courageous and ambitious and has requested this loan from the field partner to improve his working capital, develop his business and become profitable. He buys his stock from local markets and then sells it at other markets.

The profits generated will help Sidi to meet the needs of his family, such as education for his children and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy sacks of salt for resale.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila has been engaged in a hog-raising type of livelihood for three years now. This is her main source of income.

She is married with two children who are 10 and 16 years old, respectively. She lives in the town of Sagbayan, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets. This could contribute an additional number of pigs that she is about to raise. It could enable her to sell a higher quantity than usual. Slowly, she could settle her obligations and continue providing the needs of her children. Thus, she could continue to expand the business in the long run.

Leila is grateful for availing the funds that could help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is 53 years old, widowed and has three children. For income she is managing a store. She wanted to improve her sales by selling more merchandise in her store. Teodora needs additional capital so she is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to expand her business. She will buy canned goods, breads, eggs, soft drinks and soap to sell. This will increase the capacity of sales, and she will continue managing a good flow for her business. Teodora will also keep offering good products and services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, eggs, soft drinks and soap to sell.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María es una empresaria independiente que reside en Chocontá un municipio de Cundinamarca, ella es la actual administradora del restaurante familiar que fue fundado en 1941 y es una tradición en esta tierra.  Así que María tiene un reto grande y que por tres años ha estado a su disposición.  Diariamente los clientes llegan hasta el local a degustar de los platos típicos y que son sus especialidades entre ellos, cordero, chanfaina (guiso hecho con asaduras cortadas en trozos pequeños), costilla, almuerzos corrientes y desayunos.   Su horario laborar es a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m., y su proceso productivo lo realizan sus colaboradoras quienes son las expertas y mantienen las recetas intactas, quien da el aval de ello es María que está al pendiente hasta de los más insignificantes detalle.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar víveres, carnes y verduras.  Su meta a futuro es mantener las normas de salubridad exigidas y adquirir una campana extractora.  Su meta personal es ofrecer a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Maria is an independent businesswoman who resides in Chocontá, a municipality of Cundinamarca. She is currently the manager of the family restaurant which was founded in 1941, and is a tradition in the area. She has a big challenge that has been at her disposal for three years. Customers arrive daily to enjoy typical dishes, their specialties are lamb, stew (made from small pieces of grilled meat), ribs, contemporary lunches and breakfast. 

She works from 5 am until 7 pm. Her production process is carried out by her expert assistants who maintain the exact recipes. They support Maria who sees to even the most insignificant detail. She is currently applying for her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo to purchase supplies, meat, and vegetables. Her goal in the future is to maintain the high standards of health requirements and acquire a cooking hood. Her personal goal is to offer her children a quality education.

loans.use: purchase supplies, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Massan  Agbemoli

texts.fr: Veuve de 53 ans, Massan est une femme qui vit à Tokoin et est mère de deux enfants. Massan se bat énormément dans son commerce de poissons fumés pour subvenir  à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Massan sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de poissons en vue d’avoir un stock important et mieux vendre pour gagner plus de bénéfices afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Massan is fifty-three years old, widowed and mother to two children. She lives in Tokoin and works hard selling smoked fish to earn a living for herself and her children.

Massan has requested this loan to buy boxes of fish to increase her stock levels. Her increased earnings will improve her children's standard of living and provide them with a good education.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of fish.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo is starting up a fish-selling business to provide for the needs of his family. He is a 44-year-old man who lives in a town of Baybay in Leyte, Philippines. He is a father of eight children. His oldest child is 19 years while his youngest child is 4 years old. His wife stays at home and takes good care of their children. This is the reason why Gerardo works hard every day. He dreams to have other business opportunities in the future to uplift their livelihood and have better means of living. As for now, he is asking a loan to buy more fresh fish to sell and foam (used for storing fish) to continue his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and foam (used for storing fish.)

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Akouyo est une femme mariée âgée de 55 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Akouyo est une marchande de friperies  qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Akouyo demande ce prêt pour commander des balles de friperies afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire en vue d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akouyo is fifty-five years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in Tokoin and sells second-hand clothing from her home and on foot in local neighbourhoods. She buys new stock four times a month from the market.

Akouyo has requested this loan to buy more bundles of clothing to meet the needs of her customers. Her increased earnings will provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bundles of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en: Romualda is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a 65-year-old rice farmer who tirelessly works, even at her age. All her children are adults, but she continues to work in her farm alongside her husband. She is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to pay for the labor of hired farmers. Romualda hopes to have a good harvest every six months so she can support the need for food and household expenses. She hopes to continue farming and be more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer and to pay for the labor of hired farmers.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en: Renalyn is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is managing a hog-raising business for more than three years now. She wants to ensure good growth of her hogs. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the hogs' sustenance. She hopes to continue improving her small business and to sustain the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbage, tomatoes and collard greens. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, cabbage and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will own a retail shop. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, cabbage and other items.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victoriana is 64 years old now.

Victoriana has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines. Victoriana requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shorts, pants, underwear, etc.

Victoriana has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Victoriana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shorts, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 52 years old and married with three children.

Jovita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Jovita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jovita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more grocery items to attract more customers to increase the number of sales as well as her income to cover her family's needs.

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.en:
To have a good education is everyone’s dream. Aigerim is one of those who desires to have a good one. She is happy to be a freshman at AUCA, but at the same time she is concerned about tuition fees.

There are five people in her family: her parents, herself and two younger sisters. Unfortunately, both her parents are unemployed due to their health problems. Looking for a bright future, her mother went to Moscow in 2013. After a year, she returned back sick and underwent surgery. Her father was an actor at a local Drama Theatre until he had an accident one day there. That day, he broke his leg during rehearsals, then had an operation, and from that day, he can’t walk properly. Both parents get allowance from the state social fund.

The main source of funding is her relatives, who support them from time to time as they can. In addition to that, Aigerim and her younger sisters work as part-time waitresses in cafes in summer. Aigerim says that the lack of money never hinders her or sisters to go to school and study. Instead, it motivates them to strive more in their studies. It serves as a challenge for them to hurdle and conquer. It never discourages them, but it pushes them to dream to gain a degree in the university, to have a bright and promising future. Now she is knocking at Kiva lenders’ hearts for a loan to pay for her university tuition fee. She assures you that every dime that you lend won’t be wasted. Your loan is an ultimate hope for her to finish her studies, earn a degree at AUCA that will be a ticket to get a well-paid job, and enable her to help and alleviate her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in the ICP Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
This nice and cheerful lady’s name is Varduhi and she is 35 years old. She lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. She is married and has a daughter (she is a student) and a son. Varduhi’s husband is a famous architect in their city. This lady has two higher education degrees and thanks to her intelligence she is now a highly qualified pedagogue and works in her specialty now. At school she is a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She also has a group of pupils whom she gives private courses and helps them to get prepared for the entrance exams. 

Varduhi is a respected and beloved pedagogue and colleague in the school. Varduhi is very happy to receive this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, as she wants buy a computer, accessories and also professional literature for her courses at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories and also professional literature for her courses at home.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, sugar, eggs and rice, and also runs an M-pesa business. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread and soap and to add M-pesa float. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread and soap, and to add M-pesa float.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells poultry and she also sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of poultry and vegetables. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of poultry and vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and has nine children. Maria is married and has two children who are in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maria has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Camila is 58 years old and one of her children is in school.

Camila has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Camila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

Camila has been in this business for five years. In the future, Camila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a single woman who is 35 years old now.
