Pilar has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Pilar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, at the age of 45 years, is a widower. He has one child to take care of. This farmer lives in Dambae district of Tbaung Khmum province and sustains his family’s living through growing cassava and rice. He has been doing this for 20 years and he earns about USD 11 per day. He can manage to save about USD 8 each day after daily expenses. Cassava’s outputs are low because there is drought and diseases.

This is the first time for Chantha with VisionFund; in this group of two, he is the group leader and he will use his loan to support the farming business by purchasing organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity. Some loan portion left will be used to pay for labor fees. He dreams to be able to buy a two-hectare farmland to grow cashews and soybean in order to gain more income.

loans.use: to support the farming business by purchasing organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity so as to fulfill his dream of buying a two-hectare farmland.

loans.name: Chand

texts.en:
Chand is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 25 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Chand has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Chand's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Chand also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Chand is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the taxi of her husband.

loans.name: Sokkhom's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer in Kampong Cham province, Sokkhom is 32 years old. She is blessed with two children, one of whom is in school and one is under the age of school. This woman, along with her husband, is working hard to earn an income to meet her family’s needs by growing rice on one hectare of farmland. Sometimes they harvest a rice crop for their neighbors to earn additional income. They have been doing this for 14 years and they can earn about USD 9 per day. They can save approximately about USD 6 each day for future needs. Drought causes her rice to produce a low yield and it is the main obstacle to her business.

She is a fifth-cycle client of VisionFund. Her past loans have had a huge impact on her as she can upgrade her standard of living and buy school materials for her child. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for a new loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to support the farmland. She hopes to gain more yields to reach her dream of buying an additional plot of farmland and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to support the farmland to reach her dream of buying an additional plot of farmland and continuing to send her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 57 years old now.

Eufemia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed such as nipa leaves.

Eufemia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as nipa leaves.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman with one child. She describes herself as ambitious.

She operates a retail business selling charcoal, and has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

Her business goal is to be the main supplier of charcoal in the area within five years. She hopes that in the future she will own land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elezabeth has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zohour

texts.en:
Zohour is a 46-year-old married mother of four children.

Four years ago, she started working as a tutor from her house to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and has good experience in teaching since she was employed in a school, but she prefers working from her house in order to take better care of her family. She is trying desperately to provide her children with decent living conditions.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her children's school tuition fees. She believes that education is the only guarantor for her children's future, and she hopes to stay capable of meeting their needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a 56-year-old resident of the town of San Miguel. She is married, and has five grown children. She and her husband have been rice farmers for nineteen years now. She usually earns PHP 2,000 per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and to pay for land that has been mortgaged. Once she gets her land back, she can maximize her farming income. Any profit from her rice fields will be used for food, savings and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land that has been mortgaged.

loans.name: Yulianti

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Yulianti, who is a 35-year-old married woman.

Yulianti has been making packaged snacks for two years and her husband has been a soup merchant for thirteen years. She asked for a loan of IDR 6,500,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation. Her family income is insufficient for building toilets and water sources but Yulianti will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, rice, oil, etc. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina hails from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is a 45-year-old married woman with two children, ages 17 and 25. She sells snack food near the school canteen like banana cue, hot cakes and ice candy. Aside from that, she also sells fresh fish to gain supplemental income. Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients like flour and sugar, and to purchase a variety of fresh fish. With these, her livelihood will become productive and she would be able to roll-out her capital as well. Thus, she could start to settle her obligations and continue to provide her family with healthy diets.

She dreams that someday she will become successful and productive, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, and to purchase a variety of fresh fish.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 34 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ivy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lotions, face masks, make-up, deodorants, cream and other products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lotions, make-up, deodorants, creams and different types of beauty products.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 43 year old man, married with 2 young daughters, 10 and 9 years old. He works hard every day, which alows his wife to take care of their daughters. He enjoys his work, specially when he thinks about his daughters. "I like working hard to see my daughters succeed, may be see them get a degree or something like that, I just don't want to see them struggle with life the way I did". Everything Samuel does is for his daughters.

Samuel makes a living by working at his own appliances workshop. In this he buys broken appliances like washing machines, dryers or blenders, then he fixes them and resells them. He also works in people's homes.

He now dreams about creating a rental laundry place, so he is looking for washing machine to rent. He thinks this business is ideal for him because he will have all the supplies to fix a broken washing machine and because he know where to buy laundries at a good price.

To achieve this he is looking for a 10,527.00 MXN loan, with which he may buy the supplies that he needs to fix all the appliances, and some washing machines to start his business

loans.use: to continue fixing washing machines and to open a laundry as his business.

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en:
Hamdan is 33 years old and a married father of four. Hamdan works as a motorcycle rider and he also raises livestock. With a few goats, Hamdam also grows vegetables in addition to cultivating maize.

Hamdan, in his words, says loans help the low income earners to own home assets, as well as meeting school expenses. Sometimes not all villages have public elementary and secondary schools, so the bulk of paying tuition falls on the parents making them to toil so hard to meet these expenses.

Hamdam is requesting for a loan to pay the balance on a new motorcycle so that he can increase his income. He will use a portion of his loan to pay tuition for his children.
Pictured is Hamdan and his wife. They appreciate the good work of the Kiva funders.

loans.use: pay for a new motorcycle so as to help him pay school fees.

loans.name: Mirian Silvana

texts.es:
Miriam continúa con su negocio de venta de productos de temporada. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de juguetes de temporada. El pago de sus cuotas fue normal. En esta oportunidad el crédito que solicita es para la compra de regalos para la fiesta de la primavera, “mi madre me cedió un espacio para venda a fuera de su negocio, es por eso que quiero aprovechar el comercio del lugar…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que ahora cuenta con un espacio en las afueras del negocio de su madre para poder vender, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para bastecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ella desea comprar regalos para la fiesta de primavera. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que lleva con esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para la compra de regalos de temporada para la fiesta de la primavera.
texts.en:
Miriam continues to work at her business selling seasonal products.

She used her last loan to buy seasonal toys. The loan was repaid on time.

On this occasion, Miriam is applying for a loan in order to buy gifts for spring festivals..

She says, "My mother gave me a space to sell products outside her business so I want to take advantage of the location."

What is good about the business is that now Miriam has a space to sell outside her mother's business; less good is the lack of capital to stock up her business.

Miriam's dream is to own her own house. She wants to buy gifts for the spring festivals. This is Miriam's second loan with Emprender in the eight years that she has had her business.

For the above reason, Miriam is applying for a loan in order to buy gifts for the spring festivals.

loans.use: to buy gifts for spring festivals.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 46 year old women, living with her husband and six children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is responsible woman. Her husband is an honest person. He is an honorable personality in society. He is the owner of a small restaurant, in which he serves many types of delicious food. He offers breakfast and lunch and has been running this restaurant for many years.

But he is earning insufficient profits due to the poor conditions of this restaurant. He cooks the delicious food for his customers and the people like to eat there.
But the condition of his restaurant is very bad. The seating arrangement is poor, it has rough walls, a dark room and no electricity supplies available. The customers feel hesitant to come inside the restaurant.

Sharifan’s husband wants to re-establish his restaurant by redecorating it. He wants to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply and buy new furniture.

Therefore, Sharifan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan ,so that her husband can redecorate his restaurant.
Sharifan will be thankful to KIVA and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve the bad conditions of the small restaurant run by her husband, by painting it, having new furniture and electricity.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is engaged in selling food to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years to help her husband sustain their daily living. She is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar. In the future, she dreams to own a sari-sari store to help them uplift their livelihood so they could have better means of living. Rosemarie is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her family in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. She and her husband were blessed with a 10-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy  flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 55 years old. He is married to Paulina who is a farmer, and they are blessed with three children 20 years, 18 years and 15 years old. He has had a dairy business for 15 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 15,000. He has borrowed KES. 20,000 from Visionfund Kenya as his second loan, after paying the previous loan successful. 

And he will be using the loan to purchase a cow, henceforth he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him, to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his children, cater for medical care,expanding his current business and repay his loan too. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful dairy business and enjoy a better life with his wife and children

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the improvement of his family's life.

loans.name: Kkm Group

texts.en:
Rehema who is in her mid 30s is married with six children who are still at school. She has been running two projects, retail shop and genge for five years now. She works from 8am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increasing the shop stock and started a genge business. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the retail inventory and to restock the out of stock items in the genge store. She dreams of opening factory for producing juice and a brick factory

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group KKM which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the retail inventory of her shop and to restock the out of stock items in the genge store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps dairy cows. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a Kiva borrower. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be energetic. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are regular.

He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to hire more laborers to dig more stones. His business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to hire more laborers

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
In Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region Ashot lives with his wife. They have a son who with his family lives and works in the Russian Federation. Ashot used to work as an electrician at different organizations, but now his only occupation is farming.

He mentions his farm is not a big one and here he takes care of a cow, sheep and chickens. He sells a little milk, eggs and also mutton and poultry. His land’s harvest, potatoes, cabbage, tomato and greens, he sells locally to his neighbors and re-sellers who take it from his farm.

This loan of 150.000 Armenian drams Ashot asks as his farm animals have lack of fodder for the winter and he wants to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a single woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosana is 24 years old now.

Rosana has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

Rosana has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Rosana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Fairouz

texts.en:
Fairouz is a 21-year-old married mother of one child. Two years ago, she started selling cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is now well-known among her region and has a good reputation among her customers. 
Fairouz is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' need in the upcoming Fitr feast. 
Fairouz hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers in the upcoming Fitr feast

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a Kiva borrower with 4 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, flour, rice, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with proceeds from the business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items for her shop.

loans.name: Edena

texts.en:
Edena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edena is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Edena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Edena requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like salt, vinegar, vegetable, etc..

Edena has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Edena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like salt, vinegar, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Nanam Group

texts.en: Nouk’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Nouk and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Nouk and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Nouk’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Living in Takeo province, Cambodia, Pech is 22 years old and a university student. He can earn an income to support his studying and living via working as an intern. This is Pech first Kiva loan with VisionFund and he will spend this loan to pay for preparing the necessary documents, such as passport and visas, as he has passed to join a training for nine months abroad.

Pech wishes that he can get more knowledge, experiences and improve his skills so that he can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for preparing the necessary documents such as passport and visas to join a training abroad, so as to improve his skills.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Torn is a farmer living with wife and 2 children in Koh Trong Village. He is a hard working farmer. He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming since the farm is far away from his house. He puts all his effort in order to make his family live in better condition. They do not have electricity.

Torn wants to save the utility fees he spends every week on a car battery. Car battery is not a reliable source. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Moreover, he has to go to charge battery every 2 or 3 days.

After he found out that solar energy is the source he needs, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for good quality solar home systems. He believes solar home system can reduce his burden and make him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Koh Trong Village, Koh Trong Commune, Kratie Distr

loans.name: Jean Jean

texts.en:
Jean Jean is a 40 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a mother to four children ages four to fifteen. To provide for her children, Jean Jean tried her best at farming rice, operating a Sari-sari (general) store business, and raising hogs. 

She is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy fertilizer, chips, canned goods, toiletries and fertilizer. Jean Jean hopes to have another business someday so she can support the schooling of her children. In the future, she hope to make a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chips, canned goods, toiletries and fertilizer

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and flour. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be the leading cereals seller . This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Glena

texts.en:
Glena is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Glena is 22 years old now.

Glena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Glena requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Glena has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Glena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en:
Salinah, 44, is a smallholder mixed-farmer from Kapsowar, Kenya. She has five children. She has been selling milk, eggs and food crops from her farm for 15 years. These primary income sources have sustained him and her family for all this time. However, the income is not enough to fulfill her family’s basic needs. This has forced him to venture into other numerous side businesses.

There is no denying that Salinah loves what she is doing. She names all the animals on her farm. She spends her free time planting and weeding vegetables. Her passion enables her to overcome her biggest challenge, which is marketing her products.

Salinah is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. She is planning to use these farm inputs, which include, preparing for the coming season. Farming costs are increasingly becoming expensive for small scale farmers who rely on the income they generate from their previous harvest. When farmers experience a loss or small profits from their harvest, they become incapable of footing farming costs for the next season.

Your loan will help such a farmer to purchase necessary inputs. By supporting their economic activity, you are empowering them.

Salinah plans to continue farming in order to make money for her children's welfare and education. She said, "This loan will help me boost my living conditions.'

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.name: Pev

texts.en:
Pev works as a farmer living with wife and 3 children in Koh Trong Village. Pev is a hard working farmer. He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming and also to feed his pigs. He puts all his effort in order to make his family live in better condition.

He does not have electricity. However, his current power won’t make him achieve his goal. It is a money and time consuming. Pev has to go to a charge battery every 2 or 3 days. After he found out that solar energy is the source he needs, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for good quality solar home systems. He believes solar home system can reduce his burden and make him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems

location.town: Koh Trong Village, Koh Trong Commune, Kratie Distr

loans.name: Mardiah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Mardiah, who is a 29-year-old married woman. Mardiah has been selling and crediting clothes and electronics and her husband is a nurse for three years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to access a water source at their home to improve access to clear water and build a toilet for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet and water sources but Mardiah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to access a water source at their home and build a toilet for their family.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a retailer operating on a busy street in town and he has been in that business since 2009 to earn a living. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda where he grows and sells cocoa, a common agricultural activity in the area to supplement income from the general store shop. He dreams of expanding his business, however, he is limited by inadequate financial resources to fulfill all his ambitions of owning a bigger whole sale business in town. He has asked for a loan of two millions to buy sugar for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar for selling in his general store.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en: Lonah is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Thongkhae Group

texts.en:
Bounma understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Bounma has purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent on buying charcoal, and by decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, when it is available.

Bounma is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that it is guaranteed for 2 years. This means that he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Since the university was founded in 1993, AUCA has proven its capability of providing a high level of education. Excellence in everything has always been its way of practice. Its community implements all the democratic values of a modern and developed society. All these circumstances attracted Elisa’s attention to the university in the beginning, and now she enjoys a spirit of friendliness and collegiality that foster constructive discussion and exciting ideas among students.

Elisa was a diligent schoolgirl. Her parents always supported her in all her beginnings, but when she was admitted to AUCA and to Shanghai University in Great Britain, they asked her to stay with them as they were afraid that a UK education would cost much more than the best university in Central Asia.

Elisa has a very big family of 8: her parents, elder brother, herself, three younger sisters and a younger brother. Her elder brother graduated from the university this summer and is searching for a good job. Her three younger sisters are schoolgirls, and her youngest brother is only 4 years old.

Elisa’s mother is a doctor by profession, but due to the help needed in the household for her children, she is a housewife. Of course, it’s really hard for Elisa’s father to make ends meet as he is the only bread-winner. He works as an employee of a local bank. His salary allows them to have a modest life and being an economist helps him to distribute his income evenly.

When Elisa entered AUCA, her father continued to support her idea and began to search for funding. He analyzed local banks’ loans and came to the conclusion that he couldn't get them as they have high rate fees. Elisa applied for AUCA financial aid and her family was so happy to learn about the interest-free Kiva loan for AUCA students. Another reason which made them doubly happy was that they could repay it after Elisa’s graduation.

Elisa thanks Kiva lenders for their consideration of her profile and she will try to exceed lenders’ and her parents’ expectations.

loans.use: to pay for her Bachelor Degree at AUCA

loans.name: Waeni

texts.en:
Waeni is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, milk, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

Waeni will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, cereals and other items.

She hopes that in the future she can educate her children to university level and expand her business significantly.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, cereals and other items.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar es un microempresario de 55 años que reside en Bogotá y tiene como profesión la contaduría, sin embargo se encuentra dedicado al negocio que heredó de su padre un taller de calzado.  Oscar siempre estuvo vinculado a esta labor y de la mano de su padre aprendió, años más tarde, cuando su progenitor ya no podía trabajar por su avanzada edad, tomó las riendas del negocio en el que hasta el día de hoy cuenta con 30 años de funcionamiento en las instalaciones de su vivienda.   Este tradicional taller distribuye a almacenes mayorista una amplia variedad de calzado de cuero todos los fines de semana, por lo que es importante mantener una producción ágil y a la vanguardia, es así cómo Oscar decidió aplicar a una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar cuero e insumos con los que pretende estar preparado para la producción de fin de año.  Con esta inversión se anticipará a las alzas de los productos por las temporadas que se avecinan y respaldará su meta de tener una mayor solvencia económica para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar is a micro-businessman. He is 55 years old and lives in Bogotá. He is an accountant by trade, but nonetheless he works at the business he inherited from his father, a cobbler's shop. Oscar has always been connected to this work and he learned it from his father. Years later, when his father was unable to work any longer because of his advanced age, he took the reins of the business, which to this day has been functioning from his house for 30 years. This traditional workshop distributes a wide variety of leather shoes to wholesalers every weekend. That is why it is important to maintain agile, cutting edge production. It's the reason why Oscar decided to put in an application for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy leather and materials so that he can be prepared for the end of the year production. With this investment, he will stay ahead of the rise in demand for the coming season and he will support his goal of having more financial liquidity to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather and materials.

loans.name: Olga Elvira

texts.es: Olga de 44 años de edad, quien tiene 32 años de residir en vivienda propia junto con un hijo de 23 años y una hija de 20 años de edad. Olga es madre soltera y para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos instaló una pequeña tienda con productos básicos para el hogar, con la cual con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación cubre las necesidades básicas del hogar. Aparte de la tienda que instaló, también cuenta con un pequeño negocio de comidas típicas tales como: yuca, pasteles y enchiladas, el cual administra por las tardes. Olga tiene el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, especias, salsas, aceite, y muchos otros productos para la venta en su tienda. Y así de esta forma mejorar su negocio y a la vez su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olga is 44 years old. She has been living in her own home for 32 years and her 23 year old son and 20 year old daughter live there with her. Olga is a single mother and in order to get her children ahead she opened a small store selling basic products for the home. In addition to the store she opened, she also has a small business selling traditional food, such as yucca, pastries and enchiladas, which she runs in the afternoons. Olga wants to improve her and her family's quality of life and to do that she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in basic grains, spices, sauces, oil and many other products to sell in her store. This way, she will improve her business and at the same time, her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, spices, sauces, oil, and many other products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in creams, masks, lipsticks, lotions, deodorants and a variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Pedro Moises

texts.es:
Pedro, de 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, está acompañado, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 de estos estudian 
y dependen directamente de los ingresos de él; mientras su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar  y a cuidar a sus hijos.

Pedro, posee una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace 3 años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio, porque un amigo lo motivo y lo impulso a hacerlo, porque en el lugar habían pocos negocios, además de esto realiza otras actividades como lo es la siembra de granos básicos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar productos como: café, frijol, maíz, azúcar, boquitas y galletas, ya que con el incremento del negocio, logrará tener mejores ganancias.

Sus principales sueños son, construir una nueva vivienda, que sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school, because his family was low income. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school and who depend directly on his income. His spouse takes care of the home and the children.

Pedro has had a small store in his house for 3 years. He decided to work at this business because a friend motivated him and drove him to do it because in the area there were few businesses. In addition to this, he does other activities such as growing basic grains.

He needs the loan to buy products such as coffee, beans, corn, sugar, snacks, and cookies. With the increase in the business, he will be able to have better profits.

His main dream is to build a new store and for his children to have an opportunity to keep getting an education.

loans.use: to buy products such as coffee, beans, corn, sugar, snacks and cookies.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María es reside en Chocontá un municipio de Cundinamarca en donde sus hijos se trasladaron oriundos de Boyacá en la búsqueda de oportunidades de empleo y como María es separada, sus hijos son su única compañía, ella decidió también buscar nuevos horizontes trasladándose hasta este pueblo.  Rentó una tienda en el municipio y ya cuenta con un año de funcionamiento, ofreciendo a la comunidad víveres, frutas y verduras, productos para el aseo y bebidas.  Diariamente apertura su negocio a las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 10 a.m. un horario bastante extenso, pero hace parte de su entrega y dedicación.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar abarrotes, víveres, carnes, lácteos y verduras, y así responder a la demanda del sector. Su meta a futuro es poder consolidarse en el sector como un punto de venta de variedad y productos de primera necesidad.  Su meta primordial es la familiar y consiste en continuar apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y comprar una casa en Chocontá.
texts.en:
María lives in Chocontá, a municipality in Cundinamarca. Originally from the Boyacá region, her children moved to Chocontá in search of work opportunites, and since María is separated and her children are her only company, she decided to seek out new horizons by moving to this town also. She rented a store in the municipality, which has been in operation for one year, offering the community groceries, fruits and vegetables, cleaning products, and drinks. She opens her store every day at 6 a.m. and closes at 10 p.m., long hours that reflect María's hard work and dedication.

Currently, María is applying for her first Kiva loan trough the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy groceries, supplies, meats, dairy products, and vegetables so that she can respond to the demands of the customers in her area. Her future goal is to become established in her area as the best place to go for variety and for basic supplies. María's top priority is her family, and she wants to continue supporting her children in their studies and to buy a house in Chocontá.

loans.use: to buy groceries, supplies, meats, dairy products, and vegetables so that she can respond to the demands of the customers in her area.

loans.name: Istat

texts.ru: Истат 41 летняя жительница города Исфара. Она замужем и у нее 2 сына в возрасте 10 и 5 лет. Муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов в городе. Истат 15 лет занимается животноводством у себя дома. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Исмат обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось мало корм для скота.  Истат намерена на заемные средства приобрести корм для скота и продвигать деятельность вперед. Она ждет Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Istat is a 41-year-old resident of the city of Isfara. She is married and she has two sons who are ten and five years of age. Her husband works in house renovation in the city. Istat has been rearing animals at home for 15 years. Animal rearing is her main activity because the income from this business provides for the family.

Istat has applied for a loan because she has little feed left for her livestock. Istat intends to buy some feed for her livestock with the borrowed funds and move her business forward. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in camisoles, panties and all types and styles of underwear for her business.

loans.name: Tavhida

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Тавхида. Она живет в городе Исфаре. Она 38 летняя женщина. Тавхида ответственная, гостеприимная и приятная в общение женщина. Она проживает вместе с мужем и четверыми детми. Дочке всего 1 лет, а сыновям 18, 16 и10 лет. Тавхида занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она продвигает эту деятельностью около 15 лет. Тавхида обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет закончить ремонт. Она не смогдла отремонтировать все комнаты, потому что для купли стройматериалы у нее нехватало денежных средств. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом. На счет заемных средств Тавхида намерена приобрести строй материалы. Она заранее выражает свою блогодарность.
texts.en:
This woman is called Tavhida. She lives in the city of Isfara. She is 38 years old. Tavhida is a responsible, hospitable and sociable woman. She lives with her husband and four children. Her daughter is just one year old, and her sons are 18, 16 and 10. Tavhida sews women's clothing to order. She has been carrying on this business for about 15 years.

Tavhida has applied for a loan because she wants to complete a renovation. She was not able to renovate all the rooms because she did not have enough funds to buy construction materials. She has applied for a loan because of her shortfall of money. Tavhida intends to buy construction materials with the borrowed funds. She expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy some construction materials to complete her house renovation.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana, de 62 años de edad, es comerciante, por motivos de recursos económicos no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está soltera y es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales estudian.

Juana, se dedica a la elaboración de tamales y platillos típicos, pero además atiende su hogar y cuida 3 nietos que le ha encargado una de sus hijas. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales para la elaboración de tamales y platillos típicos, porque este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos.

Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando para desarrollarse y tener mejores condiciones y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 62 years old. She is an entrepreneur. Due to economic motives she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is single and is the mother of three children who are in school. Juana works making tamales and traditional dishes, but in addition she attends to her home and cares for three grandchildren that her daughter entrusted her with.

She needs the loan to purchase materials to make tamales and traditional plates because this business is her only source of income. Her dream is to be able to continue working to develop herself and to have better living conditions and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make tamales and traditional dishes.

loans.name: Natig

texts.en:
Natig was born in 1972. Natig is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the city of Fuzuli. He is married and has two children, one of whom is a university student and the other, a high school student. His wife is a teacher. He and his family live in the Fuzuli region. 

In his transportation business he had insufficient income, and that is the reason why he decided to change his business. Now he has a few cows and he has been in the animal breeding business for two years. 

Natig loves his work. He needs his second loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount he is planning to buy three cows to expand his business. Natig wants to give a good future to his family. He is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy three cows to expand his business.

loans.name: Wati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Wati, who is a 47-year-old married woman. 

Wati and husband have been selling food for three years. 

She has asked for a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build toilets and water sources at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Wati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build toilets and water sources at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Dilshodjon

texts.ru: Житель прекрасного города Исфара, Дилшодчон. Ему 31 лет. Он женат и отец одного 4 летного ребенка. Дилшодчон родился и вырос в хорошом, воспитанном семье. Он тоже встарается воспитывать своего ребнко, чтобы он вырос как сам. Дилшодчон в городе замнимается мастером по ремонту домов. Он почти с детства занимается в этой свере деятельности. Уже 15 лет Дилшодчон продвигает своб любимую работу. Он хороший и опытный мастер. Хорошо справляется со своей работой. Его жена занимается торговлей деятельности. Она продает продукт питания в магазине, и Дилшодчон свободное время помогает жене в работе. Дилшодчон просит кредит для расширения деятельность жены. Он решил помочь жена расширить деятельность. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему расширить бизнес жены. За счет кредита Дилшодчон перевозит ассортимент тоаров продукт питания. Он очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Dilshodjon, a resident of the wonderful city of Isfara. He is 31 years old. He is married and the father of a four-year-old child. Dilshodjon was born and raised in a good, well-mannered family. He also tries to raise his child so that he will grow up like he did himself. Dilshodjon renovates houses in the city. He has been working in this field almost since childhood. Dilshodjon has been carrying on his beloved work for 15 years. He is a good and experienced worker. He manages his work well.

His wife is a trader. She sells produce in a store, and Dilshodjon helps his wife in her work in his spare time. Dilshodjon is asking for a loan to expand his wife's business. He had decided to help his wife to expand her business.

The requested loan will help him to expand his wife's business. Dilshodjon will buy a range of food goods with the loan. He really needs your support.

loans.use: to buy produce to expand his wife's business.

loans.name: Nameuang Group

texts.en:
Vannone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Vannone and his group are excited that water filters are available on a payment plan that made them much more affordable. 

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Vannone and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two years, filter users like Vannone’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. 

Kiva borrowers are guardians of the children in this photo.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Kratie province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school. The other one is too young for schooling. She and her husband are farmers, growing cassava and rice. They sometimes work for others for a fee to get supplementary income. They earn around USD 11 per day and can manage to save around USD 6 each day after daily expenses. 

Cassava returns low yields because there are pests destroying the crop and not enough water to supply the field.
 
This is the third time for Net to request loan from VisionFund. Based on past loans that she fully paid back, she can support her business and buy more household supplies for her family. Net will use her loan to save her cassava farming business through purchasing cassava seedlings, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer. She hopes that their new plants can grow healthily and produce high yields to upgrade their lifestyle and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase cassava seedlings, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer in order to upgrade their lifestyle and send her children to school.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old. He is married to Jane and they are blessed with three children,17, 11 and 8 years old. 

He has had a car wash business for one year, currently earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He has borrowed KES 70,000 from Visionfund Kenya as his second loan after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

He will be using the loan to purchase a car wash tank. Henceforth, he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his children, cater for medical care, expand his current business and repay his loan, too. 
   
His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a thriving car wash business and enjoy a better and improved life with his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase a car wash tank.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as patient. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as low stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a distributor of clothes within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es un tradicional barbero y estilista que ha brindado bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y tres hijos mayores de edad que se residencia en un barrio del municipio de Madrid en el departamento de Cundinamarca y que atiende una amplia clientela de este mismo sector.  Sus clientes llegan hasta su negocio preocupados por su apariencia y en cuestión de minutos quedan sorprendidos con el resultado, él ofrece cortes de cabello, tinturas y peinados que gracias a su experiencia de 25 años en la actividad los realiza con agilidad y profesionalismo.   Todos los días apertura su local a las 9 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m., un horario amplio para que nadie se quede sin ser atendido. Fernando decidió aplicar a una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para cambiar sus herramientas de trabajo y mejorar sus servicio, él es muy visionario y desea ampliar su negocio, así podrá obtener los recursos pertinentes para comprar su casa y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a traditional barber and stylist who provides for the well being of his family: his wife and three adult children.

Fernando lives in a neighbourhood of the Madrid municipality in the Cundinamarca region and works with a range of clientele from his neighbourhood. His customers come to his Barbershop concerned about their appearance. Minutes later, they are impressed with the results. Fernando offers haircuts, colouring and styling. Thanks to 25 years of experience, he works with agility and professionalism. Everyday Fernando's Barbershop is open from 9am to 9pm, ensuring everyone has the chance to visit when they can.

Fernando has applied for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy new work tools and thus improve his services. He is a visionary and wants to grow his business. This will allow him to make enough money to buy a home and improve the life ofhis family.

loans.use: to buy new work tools for his Barbershop.

loans.name: Phonyeang Group

texts.en:
Mailin and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. Mailin and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. 

And after totaling up the costs, Mailin and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. The water filter Mailin and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  

Mailin is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Amaria

texts.en:
Amaria is a 23-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. 

Amaria has been running her own beauty salon for past 10 years, and she contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of items such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business. Therefore, Amaria has applied for a Kiva loan. 

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Amaria is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is in his early 40s, is single and has two children who are still at school. 

He has been running a food shop for ten years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
  
This will be Godfrey’s 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to improve his food shop by increasing the amount of sugar, maize, and rice, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for its support of their group. 

He used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, pay rent, build a house in his village, buy a TV set, fridge and radio sets and cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to increase stock of the fast moving items in his food shop, like sugar, beans, salt, flour, rice, peas etc. He dreams of building his own house in Dar es Salaam.

Godfrey will share this loan with his loan group, Zebra, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock on the fast-moving items in his  food shop, like sugar, beans, salt,  flour, rice, peas, etc.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Махмадали житель города Турсунзаде. Он семейный мужчина. Ему 49 лет. Махмадали женат и отец четверых детей. Дети взрослые и по 25, 22, 20 и 17 лет. Они самостоятельные и заботливые дети. Старшая дочка домохозяйка, а младшая школьница. Один сын занимается мастреом по ремонту домов. Махмадали занимается животноводством у себя во дворе дома. Он занимается этими делами уже более 10 лет. 
В животноводстве Махмадали также помогают его дети после работы. Махмадали в основном разводит мелко рогатого скота и в дальнейшем после откорма перепродает их на скотном рынке. Махмадали просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько скота и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahmadali is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. He is a married man. He is 49 years old. Mahmadali is married and the father of four children. His children are grown up and they are 25, 22, 20 and 17 years old. They are independent and caring children. His eldest daughter is a homemaker, and his youngest is a school pupil. One son renovates houses.

Mahmadali rears animals at home in his yard. He has been doing this for over ten years. Mahmadali's children also help him in rearing the animals after work. Mahmadali mainly rears sheep and goats, and subsequently resells them at the livestock market after fattening them up. Mahmadali is requesting a loan to buy a few livestock and increase his flock, and in so doing to increase his income from his animal rearing business. He believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and increase the size of his flock.

loans.name: Thamdin Group

texts.en:
Houayang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Houayang and his group are excited that the water filters were available on a payment plan that made them much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Houayang and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families’ budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Houayang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka is a 57-year-old IDP (Internal Displaced Person). She is a married and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer to help her earn money.

Maleyka raises fruits and vegetables in her garden and sells them at the local bazaar. This is Maleyka’s business, and she has working in this area for 25 years. Her monthly income is 230AZN.

People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper. People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with different pesticides and not harmful. During long years of experience, Maleyka learned how to cover her customer`s demand. So, selling fruits and vegetables from houses is popular and cheaper for people to buy them in bazaars rather than in big markets.

Her income doesn’t allow covering all the demands. She is planning to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits and vegetables. Maleyka wants her sons to get a high education and have a good life. She applied for 1,200AZN .

loans.use: to expand her garden and grow more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: corn, soft cheese, pork meat and beans, tables and chairs, and beauty products to improve her income.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest.

Philip operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital to service the motorcycle.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service the motorcycle.

Philip's business goal is to own another motorcycle and a tuk tuk within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Nongkhone Group

texts.en:
Boudda’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Boudda and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Boudda and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Boudda’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Somsaard Group

texts.en:
Soudkay understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Soudkay knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Soudkay purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Soudkay is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single woman. She has two children.

Lucy operates a retail shop where she sells rice, sugar, salt, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the Kes 85,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap, salt and other items she sells.

Her business goal is to expand business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid succcessfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap, salt and other items.

loans.name: Iis

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Iis, who is 33 years old and married. Iis has been an employee in the home shoe industry for five years and her husband has been an employee for two years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Iis will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Nonkhamsong Group

texts.en: Bounpone is excited that through this loan, water filters will be available on an affordable, payment plan. When deciding on this purchase, Bounpone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. The water filters are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. Thus, the villagers discussed the costs over two years of charcoal, firewood and even bottled water. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up these costs, they recognized the substantial financial savings the water filters will provide them and their families.

loans.use: to buy TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nongkhanyoo Group

texts.en: Houan is excited that through this loan, water filters will become available on an affordable, payment plan. In deciding to make this purchase, Houan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. The water filters are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years. Thus, the villagers discussed the costs over two years of charcoal, firewood, even bottled water. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up these costs, they recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to buy TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
For almost seven years now, Ricardo has been a very busy man. He has a food vending business, selling snack food such as puto (a delicacy made of flour or rice), ice candy and bibingka (rice cake).

Ricardo is a married man with three children aged seven, five and three years old. Together with his family, he lives in the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol.

Ricardo has decided to take out a loan in the amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, condensed milk and white sugar. With these, he will be able to buy adequate stocks in order to prepare a variety of snacks to sell near the school canteen in his community. Slowly, he will be able to pay back what he owes and continue to provide for the needs of his family.

In the future, Ricardo is hoping that he will be successful in managing his livelihood for the better.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, condensed milk and white sugar.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail shop where she sells cabbages, fruits, potatoes and collard greens. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, cabbages, fruits, potatoes and other items. Her business goal is to expand business within five years.

She hopes that in the future, she will provide a quality education to her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, cabbages, fruits, potatoes and other items

loans.name: Khokkong Group

texts.en:
Phor understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Phor knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Phor purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Phor is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a married woman with two children who describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she makes liquid soap. Her primary customers are locals and she describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy ingredients for making soap. Her business goal is to expand her business and create employment for others within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making soap.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been operating his own furniture tools business for past 12 years. 

Shumaila's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise, such as woods, machinery, and other tools for his business. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these items. To fulfill the need of her husband, Shumaila requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband buy the needed merchandise. This loan will help him to earn more income, which he will use to fulfill his family's needs.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his furniture business

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Endang, who is a 43-year-old married woman. Endang has been a babysitter for two years and her husband is an employee for ten years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 3,700,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Endang will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es: Claudia de 38 años se encuentra dedicada a las ventas de productos de uso personal, los cuales promueve por medio de catálogos especializados entre sus amigos y vecinos del sector ubicado en Madrid un municipio del departamento de Cundinamarca, actividad a la que se incorporó por su situación de desempleo y que le suple algunas de sus necesidades y las de sus familia. Ella es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y en compañía de su cónyuge les ofrecen bienestar, lo que más le gusta a Claudia de su trabajo es que comparte más tiempo con ellos y realiza sus labores en el hogar sin inconvenientes puesto que se ayuda del catálogo dejándolo en la casa de sus clientes y así promociona colonias, maquillajes, cremas y demás.  En la actualidad está aplicando a una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en bisutería, perfumes y accesorios.  Con esta inversión aprovechará la temporada de amor y amistad.  Su meta a futuro es poder cancelar su crédito de vivienda y seguir creciendo como empresaria independiente.
texts.en:
Claudia, aged 38, currently works selling personal products, using specialized catalogs for her friends and locals to her area in Madrid, a town in the Cundinamarca department.

She began this work as she was unemployed, and it provides for some of her needs, and those of her family. She is a mother to two young children, and together with her partner, offers them well being.

What Claudia enjoys most about her work is that she can spend more time with her children, and work from home without inconveniences, as leaving the catalogs in her clients' homes helps a lot to promote colognes, make up, creams and other products.

She is currently requesting her first loan through Kiva, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy jewelry, perfumes and accessories. With this investment she will be able to benefit from the season of love and friendship.

Her goal for the future is to pay off her home loan and continue to grow as an independent businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, perfumes and accessories.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock of materials. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Lachashen village of the Gegharkunik region. She is a German language specialist and pedagogue. Unfortunately, she never found work in her specialty at a school. After she was married and had children, she began farming. 

Meri has a vegetable garden, where she cultivates potatoes, green tomatoes, cucumbers, and cabbage. She also has some cattle in her farm, including cows, calves, and sheep. She sells her garden’s vegetable assortment and her farm products (milk, meat, and cheese) at the city’s wholesale market.

Meri requested a loan, which she will use to buy one more cow and fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a student in Gyumri State Pedagogical Institute. She lives in Gyumri with her parents and brother. Gohar is studying hard to become a high quality pedagogist and find work in the near future. She is in fourth year of study and will earn a Bachelor's degree.

Gohar requested a loan, which she will use to pay for her last year's tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Thom province, Navy is 49 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school while the remaining one is too young to attend school. She and her husband grow cassava to earn the main source of family’s income. Additionally, they also sell grocery items to get supplemental income. Together, they earn about USD 13 per day and can save approximately about USD 7 each day for future needs. The challenge to Navy’s business is getting low output from the cassava farm.

In a group of two members, Navy, who is the group leader, is new to VisionFund. Since she found out the advantages of living in a more hygienic environment, she is now applying for a loan from VisionFund to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that the new latrine can keep her family from infectious diseases; especially her children. She also wishes to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to keep her family members from infectious diseases; especially her children.

loans.name: Agnaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo, tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu 2º empréstimo com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo produtos como: pintos, ração e vitaminas, para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende abrir um salão de beleza, ampliar o seu negócio de criação de frangos e mais tarde contrair matrimónio.
texts.en:
Agnaldo was born in Namaacha province of Maputo. He is 34 years old and lives with his common law wife and two young children. Only one attends school. He does not support anyone else.

He began working with Hluvuku in 2013. This is his second loan which he will use to increase the volume of his business raising chickens by purchasing products such as chicks, feed, and vitamins in order to meet his customers' needs.

In the future he plans to open a beauty salon, expand his poultry business, and later formalize his marriage.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins to meet  his customers' needs.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with four children. For the past seven years, she has been a farmer who grows tomatoes, cabbages, and other vegetables. Sophia’s business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital. 

Sophia is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, other farm inputs, and pay transportation costs for her produce. This will be her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Sophia hopes to educate her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, farm inputs and cover transportation costs

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, de 25 años de edad, es electricista, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la venta de pasteles de carne en su casa y solo tienen un hijo.
