Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low.

Ararat's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

Ararat hopes to receive lenders' support and sustain his farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding pigs and barley as forage for his cattle.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, de 24  años de edad, es empleada en una institución donde preparan a personas para que sean profesionales en enfermería, está acompañada, su esposo es empleado del gobierno y en esa relación han procreado una hija.

Virginia, se dedica a dar clases en una institución de enfermería desde hace dos años, viaja todos los días de lunes a viernes en autobús y hace un recorrido de 36 kilómetros para llegar al lugar de trabajo y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d. y en la tarde vende panes y refrescos.

Virginia, necesita el préstamo para comprar preparaciones para la venta de panes, refresco y gaseosas en un carretón que su esposo le compro, para que vendiera en el lugar donde viven porque es un lugar céntrico, para no solo quedarse con los ingresos del trabajo.

Los sueños de Virginia, es tener muchos empleados con la ventas de hot-dog y así tener muchos ingreso para la hija, para que se prepare academicamente y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Virginia is 24 years old and works in an institution where they prepare people as nurse practitioners. She is married and her husband is a government employee. Their relationship has produced one daughter.

Virginia has been giving classes in the nursing institution for two years. She commutes every day from Monday to Friday, travelling 36 kilometers in a bus to reach her workplace. Her hours are from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon. In the afternoons she sells breads and refreshments.

Virginia needs a loan to buy the items she will use to prepare bread, juices and soft drinks in the cart her husband bought for her so she could sell food close to where they live, which is in a central area, and not depend solely on the income from her job.

Virginia's dream is to have many employees with her hot-dog sales and generate a lot of income for her daughter, so she can have a good education and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy the items she needs to prepare breads, juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 33 years old lady and a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own bike repair shop for past 6 years. Tasleem's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandises e.g repair tools, spare parts and other parts etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these merchandises.

To fulfill the need of her husband Tasleem has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Tasleem is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's bike repair business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 49-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.

Robina's son has been running a general store for the past two years; her son is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Robina's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints, her son is not in a suitable position to buy these products to resell.

Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profit to manage his household and business.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's general store business.

loans.name: Marie De France

texts.es:
Marie es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 5 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de San Bernardino, Suchitepéquez.
Marie se esfuerza día con día para sacar adelante a su familia, ella trabaja lavando ropa de casa en casa, con esta actividad lleva a tres años, pero también trabaja como operadora en una maquinaria, con estas dos labores ha sacado adelante a su familia. Marie desde hace algunos días ha empezado con la construcción de su casa y su dinero ya no se da abasto para adquirir más materiales de construcción por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de: cemento, cal, arena y block.
Su mayor sueño es conseguir el crédito para cubrir su necesidad, pero también que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación y que logren tener una vida distinta a la que ella tubo.
texts.en:
Marie is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family. She has two daughters, aged 2 and 5. This lovely family lives in the community of San Bernardino Suchitepéquez.

Marie works hard every day to get ahead with her family. She works washing clothes, door to door. She has been doing this for three years now, but she also works as a machine operator. These two activities have helped her to get ahead with her family.

Marie started building her house some days ago, but the money she has is not enough anymore to purchase more construction materials. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy cement, lime, sand, and bricks.

Her biggest dream is to receive the loan to fulfill her need, but she also wants her children to have the best education, and that they have a different life than the one she had.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, and bricks to build his house.

loans.name: Henry Estuardo

texts.es:
Henry es un hombre de 23 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de un hijo que aún no estudia, él y su familia viven en una comunidad del caserío  Xejuyup.
Henry  con la visión de superación y darle a su familia lo mejor trabaja como piloto de moto taxi, esta labor lo tiene el desde hace tres años. El con mucho esmero sale todos los días a prestar de sus servicios a la gente que para movilizarse dependen de un trasporte, y el con afán de ir superando para que a sus hijos no les falte nada, él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un terreno en donde  próximamente construirá su casa.
Su gran sueño es comprar otro mototaxi para que sus ingresos incrementen y con ello mejore la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Henry is 23 years old and single. He has a beautiful family of one son who is not yet of school age. They live in a community in the hamlet of Xejuyup.

Aiming to improve himself and give the best to his family, Henry works as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has been doing this for three years. Every day he leaves for work eager to provide his services to the people who depend on him for transportation, and with the desire to continually improve himself so that his children have everything they need.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy a piece of land on which he will build a house very soon. His big dream is to buy another motorcycle taxi so that his income will increase, improving the life of his family.

loans.use: to buy land on which to build his house.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and three daughters; her children are doing studying. Her son has been running his own business of garment clothes selling for three years. Her son is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Her son needs to purchase different types of garment clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Nasreen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her son to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her son can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's clothing business.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She has been raising chickens and selling their eggs since 2004, with thirteen years of experience in this. Dolly is a hard working supportive mother who puts much effort into helping her husband cover their family's living expenses and sharing responsibilities. Dolly is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

She is very optimistic about life and wants to provide her children with the best education.
She hopes to remain capable of expanding and developing her business to make sure she can support her family properly.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Khumoroy

texts.ru: Хуморой ответственная женщина из Вахшского района. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Ей 43 года. Хуморой занимается бизнесом. Сыновья Хуморой тоже самостоятельные. Один из них преподователь, а другой мастер по ремонту домов. У Хуморой есть единственная дочь, которую она очень любит. Недавно ее дочь родила ребенка и для того что бы выполнить обряд укладывания новорежденного в колыбель ей необходима денежные средства, чтобы купить хорошую колыбель и другие детские вещи. Хуморой с надеждой обращается к Вам с этой просьбой. Пожалуйста поддержите её.
texts.en: Khumoroy is a responsible woman from the Vakhsh region. She is married and the mother of three children. She is 43 years old. Khumoroy runs a business. Khumoroy's sons are independent. One of them is a teacher, and the other renovates houses. Khumoroy has one daughter, whom she loves very much. Her daughter gave birth to a child recently, and in order to perform the ceremony of placing the child in a cradle she needs some funds to buy a good cradle and other children's things. Khumoroy has turned to you with this request with hope. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy a good child's cradle and other children's things for her grandchild.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman who has 4 children. She describes herself as being loving. She operates a retail business sellling clothing and has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 45,000 loan to increase her stock of clothing. Her business goal is to own a large boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live well. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Goodness 2 Group

texts.en:
Stephen's business was able to generate better revenue, and he entered into the business of selling electrical appliances. He continues with his business of selling electrical appliances. Currently, he is the representative of this group. He is the first from the right in the photo.

"A way to improve my income is to increase my stock," he comments.

The advantage of his business is that the items are not perishable; the disadvantage is that he lacks the funds to buy more electrical appliances to sell to his customers.

His dream is to open a big electrical appliance shop and expand it. He would like to buy more electrical appliances to sell to his customers. This is the first loan that he has taken from the institution in one year.

He is married with three school-going children. He is working hard because of these children so that he can take good care of them.

loans.use: to buy more electrical appliances to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Carmen Liduvina

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padre y hermanos en una comunidad del caserío Pasac.
Carmen para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, con esta actividad lleva ella 5 años. Gracias a su entusiasmo por la vida, y por las ganas de superarse su venta de banano ha fusionado muy bien durante estos años y con el deseo de incrementar su cultivo tomo la decisión de solicitar su préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno que le están ofreciendo y él quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad.
Su más grande sueño es sembrar otras 10 cuerdas de café para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
texts.en: Carmen is a 28 year old woman, she is single and lives with her parents and brothers in a community in the neighborhood Pasac. Carmen has been working in the production and sale of banana for the past 5 years in order to help her parents with the expenses of the home. Thanks to her enthusiasm towards life, and the will to get ahead and improve, her banana business has worked quite well during those years. With the intent of growing her yield she has made the decision to request a loan to purchase a rope's length (roughly half a hectare) of land which she is being offered and would like to take advantage of. Her biggest dream is to grow another 10 rope's lengths of coffee to better satisfy her client's needs.

loans.use: purchase a rope's length (roughly half a hectare) of land for farming

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Salida A Palilic Group

texts.es: Manuela (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía)  es casada con 46 años de edad, es una gran mujer que sigue liderando al grupo que con mucho entusiasmo han buscado superarse. Manuela como muchas personas han trasformado sus vidas con los préstamos de ADICLA, pues ella cuenta que ahora su negocio ha ido cambiando mucho porque cuenta con más clientes y con sus ganancias logro comprar media cuerda de terreno. Manuela nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para invertir un poco más en su negocio de ropa típica para que sus clientes tengan productos de buena calidad y a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Manuela (standing on the right) is married. She is 46 years old, and continues to lead this group, which has worked enthusiastically to get ahead. Manuela, as many other people, has changed her life through loans from ADICLA. She says that her business has changed a lot because she now has many customers, and that she could buy a piece of land with the profits she made.

Manuela needs another loan to invest a little bit more in her business of selling traditional clothes, so that her customers can find good-quality products at a good price.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Farmeeda

texts.en:
Farmeeda is a 45-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. Her husband sells different types of eatable items, e.g., chicken, daals, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Farmeeda's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Farmeeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith who is in her mid 30's is married with three children, two of them are in school and the other one is still small. She has been running several projects, selling charcoal, juice, ice cream, a shop and genge. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Judith's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the shop stock, restocked the out of stock items in the genge store, started selling charcoal, juice and ice cream. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, reinvest in business, loan repayments,built the genge store, built more shop shelves for packing shop products and a deep freezer for keeping ice cream.

She will use this loan to increase on increase on the charcoal stock and increase on the fast moving items in the retail shop. She dream of owning a juice making machine.

Judith will be accountable for paying back her loan..

loans.use: to increase on increase on the charcoal stock and increase on the fast moving items in the retail shop

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 46-year-old married mother of five children. She started, six years ago, baking "Saj" bread and preparing "Mouneh" to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is well-known among her region and has a good reputation for her tasty "Mouneh". Khadija also works in tailoring as a second source of income, and she hopes to open a separate tailoring shop in the future.

Khadija is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees, as she wants to develop her business through buying necessary foodstuff to increase her production.
Khadija hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of providing her children with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees and to buy necessary foodstuff to increase her production

loans.name: Sandra Merlibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito San Mateo se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 24  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 1 año de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Sandra con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja dos días a la semana en sus recorridos, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, una parte de los créditos ella se los da a su marido el mismo que la utiliza en sus actividades de pesca, el necesita para comprar materiales y así realizar una mejor labor al momento de pescar. Ella tiene 4 años con su negocio el cual les permite ganarse lo suyo honradamente.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y materiales de pesca que necesita su marido. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la unidad del grupo y la seriedad de la fundación. El sueño de ella es darle lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
the San Mateo credit group meets every 15 days in the beautiful getaway spot, San Mateo, in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches and visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike. In this place, the majority of residents make a living through fishing and other sea activities. This is where Mrs. Sandra lives, she is 24 years old, married and has a 1 year old son from this relationship. Her husband is a fisherman. 
Mrs. Sandra, with the intent to earn some money on her own and be able to help her husband with the home's expenses, works selling all kinds of clothing. She sells door to door, working two days a week on her routes, selling on credit and collecting every 15 days. She gives a portion of the loans to her husband who uses it in his fishing activities, needing it in order to purchase supplies and improve his performance during his fishing. 
She has been running her business for 4 years which allows them to earn their own in an honorable manner. She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, including: pants, blouses and shirts. She will also purchase fishing materials that her husband requires. 
She has been through 3 cycles with the credit group and likes the unity of the group and the integrity of the foundation. Her dream is to to provide the best for her baby.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, shirts and fishing materials

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle hails from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 35 years old and married with four children aged 6-13. With her spouse, she works hard in the farm growing rice for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and cinder blocks for house renovation. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. Any additional profit will go towards expansion of her farming business. In the future, she hopes to see her children having a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and cinder blocks

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una madre de familia que todos los días se esmera para poder obtener los ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, ella cuenta que con el crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de tener acceso logro comprar más mercadería para su tienda, pues al contar con la mercadería necesaria logro satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Ahora su tienda de abarrotes ha crecido por lo que sus ingresos también, con esta superación Elena está muy satisfecho mas no conforme, es por ello que con el afán de seguir mejorando sus servicios hacia los consumidores, ella solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: arroz, frijol, azúcar, gaseosas y golosinas.
Su mas gran de anhelo es mejorar el inventario de su tienda para que sus hijos también cuenten con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Elena is a mother who fights every day to earn an income and get ahead with her family. She says that the loan gave her the opportunity to buy more products for her store, which helped her to better fulfill her customers' needs.

Her grocery store has grown, and so has her income. She is happy with this improvement, but not satisfied. This is why, thinking of the continuous improvement of her customer service, she is requesting a new loan to buy supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, sodas, and candies.

Her biggest goal is to improve her store's stock levels, so that her children can also enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, sodas, and candies.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 37 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and is a mother of five children. Shazia's husband is professor by profession and her husband needs to purchase furniture for his school.

Shazia wants to expand her husband business to fulfill the demands of his students for this purpose her husband needs to buy different types of merchandises e.g furniture, white boards, and other accessories. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in position to buy these items.

Therefore Shazia has requested for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to expand the size of his school and helpful for him to buy the relevant merchandise.
Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy needed furniture and equipment for his school

loans.name: Juana Manuela

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito San Mateo se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad una de ellos aún vive en su casa y estudia en una universidad.  El esposo se dedica a  la pesca. 
Doña Juana es una mujer que hace lo posible para ayudarle a su marido, ella realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una lancha en la cual junto a dos personas se dedican a la pesca, el a estas personas les paga un sueldo por su trabajo, ellos salen de 15 a 20 días a alta mar, andan junto a un barco pesquero al cual le entregan todas las tardes el producto de la pesca del día, una vez transcurrido estos días ellos regresan a sus hogares para así después de varios días regresar a sus faenas en el mar, el lleva más de 30 años dedicado a esta labor con la cual se gana la vida y da trabajo para que sus compañeros puedan llevar el pan diario a sus hogares.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, hilos, anzuelos, combustible, alimentos y agua  para salir a pescar. Lleva más de 9 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque le ayuda a su marido en su labor. Sus sueños que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Crédito San Mateo group gets together twice a month in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by domestic and foreign tourists. Most of the people in this place engage in fishing or work to do with fishing.

Juana lives here. She is 44 years old. She is married with three children. One of them still lives at home and studies at university. Her husband works in fishing.

Juana is a woman that does what she can to help her husband. She is getting a loan to help her husband to use in his work. He has a boat and works with two fishermen and pays them wages for their work. They go offshore for 15 to 20 days, working together with a fishing boat to which they deliver what they have caught every afternoon. After the passing of the days they return to their home for several days and then return to their fishing work. He has been doing this work for more than 30 years with which he earns his living and gives work to his working companions so they can earn the daily bread for their homes.

This loan is to buy nets, ropes, thread, fish hooks, fuel, food, and water to go fishing. She has been in the communal bank for more than 9 years and likes it because it helps her husband in his work.

Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy nets, ropes, thread, fish hooks, fuel, food, and water.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: Fareeda is 37 years old and has been running a low-cost private school for the past 6 years. There are 160 students in her school, 91 of whom are female. She wants to buy school furniture and has applied for a loan of RS 75,000 for this purpose. Fareeda wishes to contribute to the development of her society. She wishes to make girls more aware and educated so that they can become a source of change in the future.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the school she runs.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with two children, and she describes herself as humble.  She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes.  She has been involved in this business for three years.  Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.  She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.  This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  All previous loans were repaid successfully.  She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional materials.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials for her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a single woman, who has one child.  She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, and other items.  Her primary customers are locals.  She will use the 35,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.  This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a married man with one child.  He describes himself as focused.  He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and has been involved in this business for five years.  His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals.  

He says his biggest business challenge is fluctuating prices.  He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits.  This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and he plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits for his retail business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with one child.  She describes herself as prayerful.  She operates a retail business where she sells rice and has been involved in this business for seven years.  Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals.  

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of rice.  She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the university level.  This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and all previous loans were repaid successfully.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice.

loans.name: Furaha Daraja Group

texts.en:
Juliethis in her early 30s and married with three children. One of them is still small and the other two are in school. She has been running two projects running a retail shop and a genge business. She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in the shop inventory and to increase on the genge business. She dreams of expending her business.,

Julieth will share this loan with her loan group Furaha Daraja which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in the shop inventory and to increase on the genge business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes and has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to add more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to own a tailoring company within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to add more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children and operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 1 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Thounloua Group

texts.en: Chansee understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Chansee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Chansee purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Chansee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.  Kiva borrowers are guardians of the children in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima vive en la zona de San Lorenzo en la casa de su tía, ella estudia la carrera de Derecho, para poder ser una buena abogada que ayude a las demás personas.
 Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en la profesión que está siguiendo  para tener mejor ingreso y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fatima lives in the District of San Lorenzo at her aunt’s house. She is studying for a law degree so that she can become a successful attorney who helps other people. Her future goals include working in this profession so that she can have a better income and help her family.

Fatima is requesting this loan in order to pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane's fifth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She has been doing well in her business and has since expanded her shop.

She has requested money to purchase an additional machine, and she hopes to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more fabric materials for use in her business and an additional machine.

loans.name: Masline

texts.en:
Masline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be patient.

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be reliable.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have a comfortable life.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un gran hombre con grandes propósitos en la vida,  él tiene 63 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 22 y 38 años de edad, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Diego para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de banano y cultivo de maíz, con esta labor lleva más de diez años, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como jornalero. Diego con el deseo de contar con un local donde poder instalar un mejor su negocio se ha propuesto a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de media cuerda de terreno. 
Su esperanza de vida es contar con el préstamo para poder comprar su terreno y construir su local, y tener una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is a great man with great intentions in life. He is 63 years old, single with a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 22 and 38. This lovely family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to obtain his income and get his family ahead Diego works buying and selling bananas and corn crops. He has been doing this for more than 10 years and in order to increase his income he also works as day labor. With the desire to have his own shop where he can better set up his business Diego has decided to request a loan to buy a half cuerda (a local land measure) of land.

His life hope is to rely on the loan to be able to buy the plot of land and build his shop and have more stability in his life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for construction.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is from Vorotan village where he lives with his wife and three children, ages 20, 18 and 7 years old. All his family members support Tigran with his farming business.

Tigran keeps livestock and cultivates wheat, emmer wheat and potatoes. He sells the gathered harvest in the market and gets income for his family's living.

Tigran took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it, due to his family's weak financial situation and his unemployment. But after years of tireless work, he has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Now, Tigran has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Tigran to be prepared for winter, and he hopes for the support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Gulnarkan

texts.ru: Гулнаркан, 56 лет, замужем, детей нет. Гулнаркан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается торговлей одеждой и обувью, стартовав в 2010 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнаркан, на сегодняшний день в обороте есть товар на сумму 300,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Гулнаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Gulnarkan is 56 years old, married, and has no children. Gulnarkan sells clothing and shoes as the main income for her family, having started in 2010. Thanks to Gulnarkan's hard work, today she has goods in stock to the value of 300,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of goods. Gulnarkan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business and buying some furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to open more business outlets.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Panquiney 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer casada de 48 años de edad, con una linda familia de dos hijos y ellos ya son mayores de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad del caserío panquiney.
Maria con el deseo de superarse y darle  a su familia lo mejor desde hace 5 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, vendiendo como ambulante en su mercado regional y en los circunvecinos. Su propósito en estos días es poder brindarles a los clientes un mejor servicio pues la competencia cada vez es más fuerte y ella necesita modernizar y capitalizar su negocio de ropa típica, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería tales como: güipiles, fajas y cortes.
Su gran sueño es poder hacer crecer su negocio y contar con un local donde pueda vender mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48 year old married woman with a beautiful family of two adult children. This lovely family lives in a community located in the village of Panquiney.

Maria, with the desire to succeed and give her family the best, has been working for 5 years in the sale of typical clothing. She sells on foot in the regional market and surrounding areas. Her purpose these days is to be able to give her customers a better service because competition is getting stronger and she needs to modernize and capitalize her typical clothing business. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as: traditional blouses, sashes, and skirts.

Her big dream is to be able to grow her business and have a place where she can better sell her products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell such as: traditional blouses, sashes, and skirts.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila es una gran mujer de 35 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos uno de ellos estudia en la escuela primaria y el otro aún está bajo su cuidado, ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Chocola. 
Como muchas mujeres que día con día se esmeran para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, Dalila se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo realiza ella desde la comunidad de su hogar y esto le permite a ella cuidar de sus hijos y hacer otras labores de su casa, ella lleva cuatro años ejecutando este negocio. Dalila con deseo de mejorar su calidad de servicio hacia los clientes ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de suficientes mercaderías y distintos colores y estilos. Con esta inversión Dalila espera satisfacer mejor a sus clientes y seguir superándose con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dalila, 35, is a great woman. She is married and has a lovely family. She has two children; one of them goes to primary school, and the other one is still under her care. They live in a community of Aldea Chocola.

Dalila is one of many women that work hard every day to earn an income and get ahead with their families. She buys and sells traditional clothes, working from home. This allows her to take care of her children and of the household chores. She has been in business for four years.

Thinking of improving her customer service, Dalila has decided to request a loan to buy products of different colors and styles. With this investments, Dalila hopes to better fulfill her customers' needs and continue to make headway with her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a married woman. She has three children.

Rael operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

She hopes that in the future, she will buy a pickup. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of fish.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Iglesia Arca De Noe Group

texts.es:
Juliana gracias a su entusiasmo por la vida su negocio se ha visto mejorando poco a poco, pero gracias a su liderazgo nuevamente es la representante de su grupo.
Juliana es una de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean vistas beneficiadas con los créditos a los que han tenido acceso en ADICLA, ella cuenta que con el préstamo pudo comprar suficiente mercadería para su negocio y logro que sus clientelas se sintieran satisfechas con los productos de buena calidad que ella les estaba ofreciendo,  con este avance ella está muy contenta pero no conforme y con afán de seguir mejorando en su negocio, ella está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: güipiles, fajas y cortes.
Su gran esperanza es conseguir nuevamente el crédito para una mejor y buena inversión y que sus vidas sean grandemente cambiadas con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juliana, thanks to her enthusiasm for life, has seen her business improve little by little. And thanks to her leadership she is once again the representative of her group.

Juliana is one of the many people who's lives have benefited with the loans they have accessed from ADICLA. She says that with her loan she was able to buy sufficient merchandise for her business and managed to make her clients feel satisfied with the quality products that she is offering them. But she is not content with this advance. With the desire to continue to improve her business she is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise like blouses, belts and skirts.

Her great hope is to once again be granted the loan for a greater investment and that their lives are significantly changed by the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like güipiles (blouses), belts and skirts.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 30-year-old married woman from Kutaisi city in west Georgia. She has five family members, and the only source of income they have is transfers from abroad. Inga has a school-aged son. She has a great desire to provide financial stability and a good education for him.

Inga wants to start her own business and started working at the local beauty salon. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. She couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions, because of their requirement to have business experience or stable revenue. The Start Up program is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions for the country's poor people. Most of these people do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Inga will purchase all the needed tools and will start serving locals and passers-by as a stylist.

Inga is a very motivated person, who has great desire to make her own income and provide better living conditions for her family. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed tools and start working as a stylist.

loans.name: Elías Estuardo

texts.es:
Elías es un hombre de 31 años de edad, es un gran hombre que trabaja de sol a sol para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, él tiene 31 años de edad es casado con una familia de  dos hijos de las edades entre 4 y 7 años.
Elías para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como vendedor en una tienda que se ubica en el centro de su comunidad, él tiene 7 años ejerciendo esa labor. Elías para que su familia tenga todo lo necesaria ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la remodelación de su vivienda, pues ya se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y es muy importante que su familia cuente con un hogar seguro.
Su gran sueño es conseguir el crédito para la pronta remodelación de su casa y que sus hijos sena grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Elías is 31 years old. He is an ambitious man who works from dawn to dusk so that his family does not lack anything. This 31 year old man is married with two children who are between the ages of 4 and 7.

Elías earns money to raise his family by working as a clerk in a store that is located in the center of his community. He has been doing this for 7 years. So that his family would have everything it needs Elías decided to ask for a loan in order to remodel his home because it is in very bad condition and it is very important that his family has a safe home.

His big dreams are that he gets the loan quickly in order to begin remodeling his home and that his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy materials for the remodeling of his home.

loans.name: Las Victorias Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Victorias” was recently formed in Patulul Suchitepequez on the warm coast of Guatemala and this will be their very first loan cycle! It is very thrilling for these women, who share common objectives of growing their small businesses, honing their skills as small-businesswomen and participating in educational training at their monthly meetings.

The ladies have various small businesses including the sale of tortillas, fish and firewood. One of the women has a convenience store, where she sells items that are useful in any kitchen, like oil, flour for tortillas, sugar, rice, pasta and laundry soap.

Mayra, a 23-year-old married member of the Trust Bank, stayed in school until the 4th grade. She has a 2-year-old son. Mayra’s husband works in a banana-packing plant filling boxes of bananas. She sells cosmetics by catalogue as well as used clothing from the United States. Usually the clothing comes to Guatemala packed in bales. Mayra is requesting her very first loan to purchase more cosmetics and clothing with the objective of increasing sales and earnings so that the family is better equipped to meet their expenses.

A whole new world has opened up for Mayra and the members of Las Victorias Trust Bank. As their name suggests (victorious), they are gaining winning tools toward empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their lives. Many of us are cheering for them! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and clothing with the objective of increasing sales and earnings.

loans.name: San Antonio 2 Group

texts.en:
The seven ladies of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank San Antonio II live in the coastal city of Patulul. It is an area of Guatemala that is very humid and hot. The women range in age from 24 to 56 and have between two and seven children. The ladies were able to attend primary school between three and six years. They are very mindful of the value of education and have worked hard so that their children can be currently enrolled in primary school as well as high school.

The women are very busy with their small businesses that include the sale of tortillas, food, corn, chicken, and firewood. One lady not only sells chicken but raises them as well. Others have small convenience stores. They have joined the Trust Bank after hearing about Kiva and Friendship Bridge from their friends.

24-year-old Paola, whose business is selling tortillas, is a member of the Trust Bank. She was able to study until the third grade. Happily, her two children attend school. Paola has set herself a goal of expanding her tortilla business and wants to improve her little tortilla shop. This will be her very first loan and she is quite excited. Paola wants to buy metal sheeting as well as much more corn and firewood. This motivated woman will really benefit from the additional funds.

The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge combines educational trainings and loans. The women learn a great deal about effective business practices before they secure their first loan.

Kiva investors are greatly valued by these women who are so very appreciative of the opportunity to secure a loan! We look forward to providing a follow-up report on Paola and the ladies of the San Antonio 2 Trust Bank. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her tortilleria.

loans.name: Rosas  Blancas Group

texts.en:
The small Qiche village of San Antonio Chiquito is in the highlands of Guatemala, surrounded by lush green mountains. It is not far from Uspantan, one of the largest cities in the Department of El Quiche. There are several Mayan languages spoken in addition to Spanish: Uspanteko, K’iche and Kaqchikel.

Seven hardworking and dedicated women make up the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Rosas Blancas” (White Roses). They have a variety of small businesses including animal husbandry (chickens, pigs and cows) and small convenience stores. The women of Rosas Blancas had heard from friends about the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus Program, which provides a winning combination of small loans and non-formal education to its 22,000 clients around Guatemala. They decided to begin their own group and are asking for their first loan.

One of the members is 28-year-old Ana, who is a widow with a 10-year-old child. Her child is in the third grade, which makes Ana very happy since she was unable to go to school beyond the first grade. Ana's goal is to generate enough income with her small animal husbandry business to send her child through secondary school and then on to become a professional. She has to work extra hard since she is both mother and father to her child. Ana is asking for a loan to buy a bull and some goats.

All of the other women of Rosas Blancas, along with Ana, are looking forward to beginning their non-formal monthly education sessions, in which the Friendship Bridge facilitator will provide them with information on important topics they can use in their daily lives.

loans.use: to buy a bull and some goats for sale

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca tiene 52 años, ella es madre soltera de 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, que saco adelante sola, y por medio de su trabajo y su lucha.
Ella tiene un parador de ventas de comestibles en la ciudad de Itá, anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en la Argentina y por decisión propia vino y trabaja ya aquí y continua ayudando a su familia para poder sacarlos adelante.
 Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer comidas, como verduras, carne, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Blanca is 52 years old. She is the single mother of four children, now adults. She raised them herself through her work and striving.

She has a roadside inn selling food in the city of Itá. Previously she worked in Argentina and came here on her own initiative to continue to support her family and get them ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying ingredients to make meals such as vegetables, meat, baked goods and others. In this way she can continue with her business as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meals such as vegetables, meat, baked goods and others.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yovana; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio picantería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, carnes, entre otros insumos.
texts.en:
This is one of the members of the "San Valentín" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Yovana, one of the members, still has a "picantería" [a traditional eatery and beverage establishment]. She is a responsible and persistent person. She has had her business for quite some time now, and is doing very well thanks to how hard she works every day. She is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay the installments according to plan. She would like to continue working in order to continue helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, different types of meat, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy rice, different types of meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sisters - N5Tđông05Qnham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xoan is 55 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than ten years. Xoan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. So the amount of fish she can get from the fishermen is unstable, as is its price.

The main hardship that Xoan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. This is Xoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard. She is the group leader of Sisters - N5TĐông05QNham, which consists of four members.

In the future, Xoan hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Alphonse Group

texts.fr: Alphonse a agrandi son activité champêtre à partir du précédent crédit ainsi que le paiement de frais scolaires de ses enfants. Ce présent crédit lui permettra, une fois de plus, d'entretenir de mieux en mieux son lopin de terre avec espoir que les résultats qui en découleront pourront aisément scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Alphonse developed his farm business through the previous loan. He also used it to pay for his children’s schooling. The current loan will enable him once again to maintain better and better his patch of land, with the hope that the results from it will easily allow his children to be educated.

loans.use: to maintain a field of coffee plants

loans.name: Tiyumtaba Yapalsi Group

texts.en:
Zenabu is a 50-year-old mother of four, living in Yapalsi fong, Karaga in the northern region of Ghana. She is the individual seated first from the right among her mates in the group photo. 
Zenabu is the leader of a 26 member food stuff trading group called ‘Tiyumtaba – Yapalsi’. The group has undergone a business management training in order to well manage their businesses. There is a ready market for the food stuff business Zenabu is doing and she dreams to expand her business in the near future.
Zenabu and her group have asked for a loan of GHC 10,300.00 with her share of the loan being GHC 400.00 which would be used to buy food stuff for resale. She intends to pay back this loan with proceeds from the trade. Zenabu enjoys her business because she is able to earn more income for her family upkeep.
She thanks Kiva lenders for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff for resale.

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Zaculeu Group

texts.en:
The large village of Zaculeu is outside the bustling town of Tecpán among fields of potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, and other crops. Eleven determined women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Las Margaritas de Zaculeu. The ladies have small businesses that include handicrafts, textiles, agriculture, and commerce. The majority of them are married and they are happy that their children are in school, already preparing for their own future!

40-year-old Isabel is a member of the Trust Bank who was able to study until the ninth grade. She has been a member of Friendship Bridge through three loan cycles. Isabel has a small store in a room of her home where she sells chicken meat, beans, rice, and vegetables. She is eager to secure an additional loan so that she can buy more chicken to sell, a larger quantity and variety of vegetables, several large sacks of rice and beans, and other supplies that her customers are requesting. She works hard at the store and as her husband works far from home, takes care of their three children.

Isabel and her friends in the Trust Bank have been empowered by the monthly educational trainings that they receive from a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. After transacting business on their loans, the ladies learn how to more effectively manage their small businesses (budgeting, accounting, marketing, pricing, customer service).

It would be impossible for the ladies to walk into a bank in Guatemala to secure a loan. Kiva investors, partnering with Friendship Bridge, fill an important role in the lives of these hard-working women. Thank you, Kiva investors for your generosity and your kindness!

loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell, a larger quantity and variety of vegetables, several large sacks of rice and beans, and other supplies that her customers are requesting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Finding Nemo - N13Thảiqnham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 51 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall, selling fish for more than ten years.

Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a low-income household in the village. Furthermore, this region often suffered by natural disasters, such as storms, because it is near the sea. So, the amount and the price of fish she can get from the fishermen is unstable.

The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

In 2007, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid many loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of 'Finding Nemo - N13Thảiqnham Group,' which consists of three members.

In the future, Lan hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a farm where she grows bananas and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Felipe es un microempresario residente en un barrio del municipio de Arjona en donde compró un terreno en el que construyo un local para comercializa bebidas; una oportunidad de negocio que le ha permitido ofrecerle a su familia bienestar, él es padre de dos hijos menores de edad y en  compañía de su cónyuge les ofrecen una educación fundamentada en valores.  Gracias a su capacidad emprendedora, su negocio hoy en día cuenta con cinco años brindándole a sus vecinos y transeúntes bebidas gaseosas, cervezas nacionales y extranjeras, también sopas típicas de la región, sin embargo las expectativas a corto plazo de Felipe son mucho mayores, pero su capital es limitado, por ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para realizar adecuaciones a su local y establecer un restaurante en el que venda comidas típicas de la región.  Esta inversión es muy importante para su negocio al fortalecerle el capital de trabajo y permitir ampliar su oferta de productos.
texts.en:
Felipe is a micro-entrepreneur living in a neighborhood of the city of Arjona, where he bought property on which he built a store to sell drinks. This is a business opportunity that has allowed him to provide well-being to his family. He is the father of two young children, and he and his wife are offering them an upbringing founded in moral values.

Thanks to his entrepreneurial ability, his business now boasts 5 years of providing his neighbors and passers-by with sodas, domestic and imported beers, and soups typical of the region.

However, Felipe's short-term goals are much bigger, but his capital is limited. Therefore, he is applying for his first CrediKiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to make renovations to his store and establish a restaurant where he will sell foods common to the region.

This investment is very important for his business, as it strengthens his working capital and allows him to expand his product offerings.

loans.use: to make renovations to his location and establish a restaurant

loans.name: Tamba Sheiku

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Tamba. He is single and has three children, aged 15, 12 and 9. Tamba has two additional dependents for accommodation to be taken care of.

In 2006, Tamba established his bar and restaurant business. He began his business because he was unemployed and decided to create a way to be self-reliant. His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are the public. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 100,0000 every month from this business.

Tamba would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,0000. He requires a loan in order to buy more soft and hard drinks for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to maximize his profit and enable him to cater to more customers.

In the future, Tamba plans to educate his children and help other family members. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft and hard drinks for resale

loans.name: Suciyati

texts.en: Good day, lenders! This is Suciyati, one of Ruma's agents. She lives in Depok, a suburban area located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children. She owns and manages a small stall where she sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma and become a Ruma agent because she wants to help her husband increase their income, as well as give more contribution to her community. As the business grows, Suciyati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community, so her community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Suciyati's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to open an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Suciyati is the one who is in in her own small stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community, who needs access to such services.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.ru: Сахида, 60 лет, в разводе, есть 2 детей. У нее средне образование. Сахида работает начальником почтового отделения, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Сахиды есть 3 коровы, 5 овец. На участке мерою 0,82 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На ежедневной основе продает экологически чистое молоко. Вся экологически чистая продукция Сахиды пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль в размере около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного молока, часть средств будет направлена на постройку сарая. Доходы от кредита Сахида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Sahida is 60 years old, divorced, and has two children. She has a secondary education. Sahida works as a postmaster, and since 1996 she has also been farming for additional income for her family, having started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Sahida has three cows and five sheep. She grows potatoes and sainfoin for use on her farm and for sale on a 0.82 hectare plot of land. She sells organic milk on a daily basis. All of Sahida's organic produce is in high demand and brings her a good profit of about 20,000 som (KGS).

In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow to increase sales volume of her organic, tasty milk. Part of the funds will be directed towards building a barn. Sahida plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further growth of her business in order to be able to save up for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the volume of her organic milk sales and to build a livestock barn.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa and her husband, John, have had a fascination with computers for well over 20 years. They are self-taught, and have become extremely proficient at anything from laptop upgrade and repair to data recovery, audio conversion, and even some video services.

They have operated their business mostly for friends and family, but are now looking to take their business to the next level. The challenge for John and Lisa has been getting the word out. They know they need to set their prices lower than their competitors in order to get a foot in the door, but that’s no problem since they say competitors charge such high fees for their services. Lisa says their competitors will often charge for four hours of labor when she can get the job done in 20 minutes.

The husband-and-wife team will use their Kiva loan to cover costs associated with advertising, and to upgrade some of their hardware.

loans.use: to cover costs associated with advertising, and to upgrade some of their hardware.

loans.name: Srey Daet

texts.en: Srey Daet and husband are boat makers living in Yeav Village with 2 children. Srey Daet's boats are sold at high prices because she needs to spend a long time and energy to finish one product. She needs energy to run her business and light her house. To finish one product, she needs to spend a lot of time till night time. She does not have electricity. However, a car battery is not reliable. It has short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime car battery runs out during night time, which slows down his work . After getting good recommendation from neighbor that uses solar home systems, she decided to apply for Kiva loan to buy solar home systems. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run her business and also save utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman, aged 34 years old. She has four children who are at school. For five years now, she has had a business selling clothes and cosmetics in the same room. She is doing great, working from 10:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair profit per month.

This is her second credit request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy the same business stock, which she managed to resell. She paid back successfully the previous loan, which enabled her to generate extra income used to support her family with school fees. In the coming years, she would like to manage a big shop selling the same type of stock (clothes and cosmetics).

She will use this credit to buy new stock of clothes and cosmetics to resell in her business. Sarah will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock of clothes and cosmetics to resell in her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La  Sra. Estela tiene 33 años, tiene un hijo pequeño,  es madre soltera, y se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su hijo, quien es su motivo de lucha y la de su familia. Ella hace años viajo a otro país para poder mejorar su vida, luego regreso hace 6 años, compró para su casa y monto una despensa en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano.
Estela es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por medio de su trabajo y quiere darle a su hijo todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para la compra de aceite, arroz, fideo, yerba, harina, entre otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Estela is 33 years old and has a small child. She is a single mother who works hard to provide for her child, who is her motivation to fight for her family. Some years ago, she traveled to another country to improve her life. Six years later she returned, bought a house, and started up a store where she works each day starting early in the morning.

Estela is a very hardworking person who puts a lot of effort into her work. She wants to give her child everything that she was not able to have. She is requesting this loan to buy cooking oil, rice, noodles, yerba, flour, and other products so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 48 years old and married with three beautiful children. She has been a wholesaler of bananas in their town for almost 10 years.

From this long experience of selling bananas, she has extensive knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Rosalita still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save money for her family.

Now, Rosalita is planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business which is creating a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 100 kilos of bananas for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of bananas for wholesale.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Guzman

texts.en:
Guzman is engaged in pottery making and production in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He has been in this business for almost thirty-five years and is supported primarily by Paglaum MPC as his financial partner.

Guzman's pots and the ingenuity of his designs enable him to have customers even as far away as the Visayas areas. In need of additional capital to respond to bulk orders, he asks the co-op for a loan to pay for soil for use in pottery production.

loans.use: to pay for soil for use in pottery production.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jenerica

texts.en:
Jenerica thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can ask for financial assistance for her chosen business. Jenerica has maintained her membership in good standing without default to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Jenerica wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve, aged 35 years old, is a member of CCT's Silang branch. She is married to Joy, her business partner, and has two children; one is in high school, and the other one is not of school age yet. Genevieve, with the help of her husband, has put up a small general store, a bakery, and a fruit and veggies stand as well, to fully meet their needs and send her child to a good school.

She hopes she can access a PHP 50,000 loan to pay for grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, eggs, etc., for her store. She will use part of the loan to buy an oven for her bakery and to pay for fruits and veggies to sell at her stand. She will be grateful for your financial help, for it will help grow her livelihood.

Genevieve's precious dreams are for all her businesses to flourish and to send her child to the best school. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to sell at her store, an oven for her bakery, and fruits/vegetables to sell as well.

loans.name: Ricci

texts.en:
Ricci, owner of Fresh! Cafe & Events, is not only looking to provide organic food but is also looking to make a difference within her community.

“Our focus is on revitalizing the building, sourcing the freshest local and organic food as much as possible, raising awareness within the community about things that matter through hosting workshops and events, and providing plenty of opportunities for celebration and connection.”

She is connected with her community and truly wants to make it better. This is evident by the appreciation and the welcoming of her from her community as she had great help and support in starting her business.

With her loan, Ricci and many community volunteers can begin to make her dream come true.

“We started as a community project. Ricci and a team of 50 volunteers donated money and items, painted, pressure washed and revitalized the space. It is still a work in progress.”

Ricci’s restaurant creates an atmosphere that allows her customers to be themselves. Ultimately she lets her community know how much she truly cares through her food and her events.

“Every item is prepared fresh at the time it is ordered. We are a microwave free zone. We are the cafe that love built.”

loans.use: To help with renovations and upgrades to her space.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
Eustaquia es de la ciudad de Pilar, es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, se dedica a traer de la Argentina, artículos de primera necesidad para la casa. Se dedica a la actividad hace más de 5 años, y por medio de esto se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y luchar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, aceites, jabones, edulcorantes y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eustaquia is from the city of Pilar.  She is a merchant who works bringing goods that are basic necessities for the home from Argentina.  She's been doing this work for more than 5 years, and this is the means through which she earns a living in a decent and honest way.

Eustaquia is a very hardworking and enterprising person who wants to get ahead and who strives to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.  She is requesting this loan to invest in flour, cooking oil, soap, sweeteners, and other items.  This way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, soap, and sweeteners

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 68 years old, widowed, and has a snack-vending business in Puntod, Lopez Jaena.
